member.name: F:Stripe.Events.AccountUpdated
member.summary: Occurs whenever an account status or property has changed.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.AccountApplicationAuthorized
member.summary: Occurs whenever a user authorizes an application. Sent to the related application only.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.AccountApplicationDeauthorized
member.summary: Occurs whenever a user deauthorizes an application. Sent to the related application only.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.AccountExternalAccountCreated
member.summary: Occurs whenever an external account is created.

member.summary: Occurs whenever an external account is deleted.

member.summary: Occurs whenever an external account is updated.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ApplicationFeeCreated
member.summary: Occurs whenever an application fee is created on a charge.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ApplicationFeeRefunded
member.summary: Occurs whenever an application fee is refunded, whether from refunding a charge or from refunding the application fee directly, including partial refunds.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ApplicationFeeRefundUpdated
member.summary: Occurs whenever an application fee refund is updated.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.BalanceAvailable
member.summary: Occurs whenever your Stripe balance has been updated (e.g. when a charge collected is available to be paid out). By default, Stripe will automatically transfer any funds in your balance to your bank account on a daily basis.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.BitcoinReceiverCreated
member.summary: Occurs whenever a receiver has been created.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.BitcoinReceiverFilled
member.summary: Occurs whenever a receiver is filled (that is, when it has received enough bitcoin to process a payment of the same amount).

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.BitcoinReceiverUpdated
member.summary: Occurs whenever a receiver is updated.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.BitcoinReceiverTransactionUpdated
member.summary: Occurs whenever bitcoin is pushed to a receiver.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.CapabilityUpdated
member.summary: Occurs whenever a capability has new requirements or a new status.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ChargeCaptured
member.summary: Occurs whenever a previously uncaptured charge is captured.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ChargeExpired
member.summary: Occurs whenever a previously uncaptured charge expires.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ChargeFailed
member.summary: Occurs whenever a failed charge attempt occurs.

member.summary: Occurs whenever a charge is refunded, including partial refunds.

member.summary: Occurs whenever a new charge is created and is successful.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ChargeUpdated
member.summary: Occurs whenever a charge description or metadata is updated.

member.summary: Occurs when the dispute is closed and the dispute status changes to charge_refunded, lost, warning_closed, or won.

member.summary: Occurs whenever a customer disputes a charge with their bank.

member.summary: Occurs when funds are reinstated to your account after a dispute is closed. This includes partially refunded payments.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ChargeDisputeFundsWithdrawn
member.summary: Occurs when funds are removed from your account due to a dispute.

member.summary: Occurs when the dispute is updated (usually with evidence).

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ChargeRefundUpdated
member.summary: Occurs whenever a refund is updated on selected payment methods.

member.summary: Optional information related to the business.

member.summary: The business type. Can be company or individual.

member.summary: A hash containing the set of capabilities that was requested for this account and their associated states.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.ChargesEnabled
member.summary: Whether the account can create live charges.

member.summary: Information about the company or business. This field is null unless business_type is set to company.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Country
member.summary: The account’s country.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.DefaultCurrency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code representing the default currency for the account. This must be a currency that Stripe supports in the account’s country.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.DetailsSubmitted
member.summary: Whether account details have been submitted. Standard accounts cannot receive payouts before this is true.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Email
member.summary: The primary user’s email address.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.ExternalAccounts
member.summary: External accounts (bank accounts and debit cards) currently attached to this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Individual
member.summary: Information about the person represented by the account. This field is null unless business_type is set to individual.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Metadata

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.PayoutsEnabled
member.summary: Whether Stripe can send payouts to this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Requirements
member.summary: Information about the requirements for the account, including what information needs to be collected, and by when.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Settings

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.TosAcceptance

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Type

Expandable.

member.summary: (Expanded) The back of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationDocument.Details
member.summary: A user-displayable string describing the verification state of this document.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationDocument.DetailsCode
member.summary: A machine-readable code specifying the verification state for this document. One of document_corrupt, document_failed_copy, document_not_readable, document_not_uploaded, document_failed_other, document_fraudulent, document_invalid, document_manipulated, document_too_large, or document_failed_test_mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationDocument.FrontId
member.summary:
(ID of a ) The front of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification.
Expandable.

member.summary: (Expanded) The front of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.CurrentDeadline
member.summary: The date the fields in currently_due must be collected by to keep payouts enabled for the account. These fields might block payouts sooner if the next threshold is reached before these fields are collected.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected to keep the account enabled. If not collected by the current_deadline, these fields are moved to past_due and the account is disabled.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.DisabledReason
member.summary: If the account is disabled, this string describes why the account can’t create charges or receive payouts.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.Errors
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected again because validation or verification failed for some reason.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As fields are needed, they are moved to currently_due and the current_deadline is set.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: The fields that weren’t collected by the currently_due. These fields need to be collected to enable payouts for the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.PendingVerification
member.summary: Additional fields that may be required depending on the results of verification or review for provided requirements. If any of these fields become required, they appear in or .

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirementsError.Code
member.summary: The code for the type of error.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirementsError.Reason
member.summary: An informative message that indicates the error type and provides additional details about the error.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirementsError.Requirement
member.summary: The specific user onboarding requirement field (in the requirements hash) that needs to be resolved.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettings.BacsDebitPayments
member.summary: Settings specific to BACS debit charging on the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettings.Branding
member.summary: Settings used to apply the account’s branding to email receipts, invoices, Checkout, and other products.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettings.CardPayments
member.summary: Settings specific to card charging on the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettings.Dashboard
member.summary: Settings used to configure the account within the Stripe dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettings.Payments
member.summary: Settings that apply across payment methods for charging on the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettings.Payouts
member.summary: Settings specific to the account’s payouts.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettings.SepaDebitPayments
member.summary: Settings specific to SEPA Debit charging on the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBacsDebitPayments.DisplayName
member.summary: The Bacs Direct Debit Display Name for this account. For payments made with Bacs Direct Debit, this will appear on the mandate, and as the statement descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBranding.IconId
member.summary:
(ID of a ) An icon for the account. Must be square and at least 128px x 128px.
Expandable.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBranding.Icon
member.summary: (Expanded) An icon for the account. Must be square and at least 128px x 128px.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBranding.LogoId
member.summary:
(ID of a ) A logo for the account that will be used in Checkout instead of the icon and without the account’s name next to it if provided. Must be at least 128px x 128px.
Expandable.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBranding.Logo
member.summary: (Expanded)A logo for the account that will be used in Checkout instead of the icon and without the account’s name next to it if provided. Must be at least 128px x 128px.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBranding.PrimaryColor
member.summary: A CSS hex color value representing the primary branding color for this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBranding.SecondaryColor
member.summary: A CSS hex color value representing the secondary branding color for this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPayments.DeclineOn
member.summary: Automatically declines certain charge types regardless of whether the card issuer accepted or declined the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPayments.StatementDescriptorPrefix
member.summary: The default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made. This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor specified on the charge. statement_descriptor_prefix is useful for maximizing descriptor space for the dynamic portion.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsDashboard.DisplayName
member.summary: The display name for this account. This is used on the Stripe Dashboard to differentiate between accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsDashboard.Timezone
member.summary: The timezone used in the Stripe Dashboard for this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsDeclineOn.AvsFailure
member.summary: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect ZIP or postal code. This setting only applies when a ZIP or postal code is provided and they fail bank verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsDeclineOn.CvcFailure
member.summary: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect CVC. This setting only applies when a CVC is provided and it fails bank verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayments.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: The default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made. This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor specified on the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayments.StatementDescriptorKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayments.StatementDescriptorKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayouts.DebitNegativeBalances
member.summary: A Boolean indicating if Stripe should try to reclaim negative balances from an attached bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayouts.Schedule
member.summary: Details on when funds from charges are available, and when they are paid out to an external account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayouts.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: The text that appears on the bank account statement for payouts. If not set, this efaults to the platform’s bank descriptor as set in the Dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsSchedule.DelayDays
member.summary: The number of days charges for the account will be held before being paid out.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsSchedule.Interval
member.summary: How frequently funds will be paid out. One of manual (payouts only created via API call), daily, weekly, or monthly.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsSchedule.MonthlyAnchor
member.summary: The day of the month funds will be paid out. Only shown if interval is monthly. Payouts scheduled between the 29th and 31st of the month are sent on the last day of shorter months.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsSchedule.WeeklyAnchor
member.summary: The day of the week funds will be paid out, of the style ‘monday’, ‘tuesday’, etc. Only shown if interval is weekly.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsSepaDebitPayments.CreditorId
member.summary: SEPA creditor identifier that identifies the company making the payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountTosAcceptance.Date
member.summary: The Unix timestamp marking when the Stripe Services Agreement was accepted by the account representative.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountTosAcceptance.Ip
member.summary: The IP address from which the Stripe Services Agreement was accepted by the account representative.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountTosAcceptance.UserAgent
member.summary: The user agent of the browser from which the Stripe Services Agreement was accepted by the account representative.

member.name: P:Stripe.ApplePayDomain.Deleted

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.summary: String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Amount

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.AvailableOn

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Created

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Description

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.ExchangeRate
member.summary: The exchange rate associated with this transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Fee
member.summary: Fees (in cents) paid for this transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.FeeDetails
member.summary: Detailed breakdown of fees (in cents) paid for this transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Net
member.summary: Net amount of the transaction, in cents.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.ReportingCategory
member.summary: Learn more about how reporting categories can help you understand balance transactions from an accounting perspective.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.SourceId
member.summary: The ID of the Stripe object to which this transaction is related.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Status
member.summary: If the transaction’s net funds are available in the Stripe balance yet. Either available or pending.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.Type
member.summary: Transaction type. Learn more about balance transaction types and what they represent.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransactionFeeDetail.Amount
member.summary: Amount of the fee, in cents.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransactionFeeDetail.Application
member.summary: ID of the Connect application that earned the fee.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransactionFeeDetail.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransactionFeeDetail.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransactionFeeDetail.Type
member.summary: Type of the fee, one of application_fee, stripe_fee or tax.

member.name: P:Stripe.Balance.Object
member.summary: String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Balance.Available

member.name: P:Stripe.Balance.ConnectReserved

member.name: P:Stripe.Balance.Issuing
member.summary: Funds that can be spent on your cards issued via Issuing.

member.name: P:Stripe.Balance.Livemode

member.name: P:Stripe.Balance.Pending

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceAmount.Amount

member.summary: Breakdown of balance by source types.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceDetails.Available
member.summary: Funds that are available for use.

member.name: P:Stripe.BillingPortal.SessionCreateOptions.Customer

member.summary: The URL to which Stripe should send customers when they click on the link to return to your website. This field is required if a default return URL has not been configured in the Dashboard portal settings page.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.Object
member.summary: String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.AccountId
member.summary: ID of the account the capability is associated with.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.Requested
member.summary: Whether the capability has been requested.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.RequestedAt
member.summary: Time at which the capability was requested. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.Requirements
member.summary: Information about the requirements for this capability, including what information needs to be collected, and by when.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.Status
member.summary: The status of the capability. Can be active, inactive, pending, or unrequested.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.CurrentDeadline
member.summary: The date the fields in currently_due must be collected by to keep the capability enabled for the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected to keep the capability enabled. If not collected by the current_deadline, these fields appear in past_due as well, and the capability is disabled.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.DisabledReason
member.summary: If the capability is disabled, this string describes why. Possible values are requirement.fields_needed, pending.onboarding, pending.review, rejected_fraud, or rejected.other.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.Errors
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected again because validation or verification failed for some reason.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As they become required, these fields appear in currently_due as well, and the current_deadline is set.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: The fields that weren’t collected by the currently_due. These fields need to be collected to enable the capability for the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.PendingVerification
member.summary: Additional fields that may be required depending on the results of verification or review for provided requirements. If any of these fields become required, they appear in or .

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Object
member.summary: String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a 0-decimal currency) representing how much to charge. The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.AmountRefunded
member.summary: Amount in cents refunded (can be less than the amount attribute on the charge if a partial refund was issued).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ApplicationFee
member.summary: The application fee (if any) for the charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application application fee (if any) for the charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.AuthorizationCode
member.summary: Authorization code on the charge. This property is not returned as part of standard API requests.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.BalanceTransactionId
member.summary: ID of the balance transaction that describes the impact of this charge on your account balance (not including refunds or disputes).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.BillingDetails
member.summary: Billing details of the payment method used in the payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.CalculatedStatementDescriptor
member.summary: The full statement descriptor that is passed to card networks, and that is displayed on your customers' credit card and bank statements. Allows you to see what the statement descriptor looks like after the static and dynamic portions are combined.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Captured
member.summary: If the charge was created without capturing, this boolean represents whether or not it is still uncaptured or has since been captured.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code representing the currency in which the charge was made.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.CustomerId
member.summary: ID of the customer this charge is for if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Destination
member.summary: The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of, with an automatic transfer. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Dispute
member.summary: Details about the dispute if the charge has been disputed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Disputed
member.summary: Whether the charge has been disputed. More than one dispute may exist on this charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.FailureCode
member.summary: Error code explaining reason for charge failure if available (see the errors section for a list of codes).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.FailureMessage
member.summary: Message to user further explaining reason for charge failure if available.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.FraudDetails
member.summary: Information on fraud assessments for the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.InvoiceId
member.summary: ID of the invoice this charge is for if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Level3
member.summary: Details about the level III data associated with the Charge. This is a gated property and most integrations can not access it.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a charge object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the charge in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.OnBehalfOfId
member.summary: The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of without triggering an automatic transfer. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.OrderId
member.summary: ID of the order this charge is for if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Outcome
member.summary: Details about whether the payment was accepted, and why.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Paid
member.summary: true if the charge succeeded, or was successfully authorized for later capture.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.PaymentIntentId
member.summary: ID of the payment intent this charge is for if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.PaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the PaymentMethod associated with this charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.PaymentMethodDetails
member.summary: Transaction-specific details of the payment method used in the payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: This is the email address that the receipt for this charge was sent to.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ReceiptNumber
member.summary: This is the transaction number that appears on email receipts sent for this charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ReceiptUrl
member.summary: This is the URL to view the receipt for this charge. The receipt is kept up-to-date to the latest state of the charge, including any refunds. If the charge is for an Invoice, the receipt will be stylized as an Invoice receipt.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Refunded
member.summary: Whether or not the charge has been fully refunded. If the charge is only partially refunded, this attribute will still be false.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Refunds
member.summary: A list of refunds that have been applied to the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.ReviewId
member.summary: ID of the review associated with this charge if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Source
member.summary: For most Stripe users, the source of every charge is a credit or debit card. This hash is then the card object describing that card.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.SourceTransferId
member.summary: The transfer ID which created this charge. Only present if the charge came from another Stripe account. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a charge. This will appear on your customer’s credit card statement.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Status
member.summary: The status of the payment is either succeeded, pending, or failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.TransferId
member.summary: ID of the transfer to the destination account (only applicable if the charge was created using the destination parameter).

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeFraudDetails.StripeReport
member.summary: Assessments from Stripe. If set, the value is fraudulent.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeFraudDetails.UserReport
member.summary: Assessments reported by you. If set, possible values of are safe and fraudulent.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.NetworkStatus
member.summary: Possible values are approved_by_network, declined_by_network, not_sent_to_network, and reversed_after_approval. The value reversed_after_approval indicates the payment was blocked by Stripe after bank authorization, and may temporarily appear as “pending” on a cardholder’s statement.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.Reason
member.summary: An enumerated value indicating a more detailed explanation of the outcome’s type. See understanding declines for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.RiskLevel
member.summary: An enumerated value indicating a more detailed explanation of the outcome’s type. See understanding declines for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.RiskScore
member.summary: Stripe’s evaluation of the riskiness of the payment. Possible values for evaluated payments are between 0 and 100.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.RuleId
member.summary: The ID of the Radar rule that matched the payment, if applicable.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.SellerMessage
member.summary: A human-readable description of the outcome type and reason, designed for you (the recipient of the payment), not your customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.Type
member.summary: Possible values are authorized, issuer_declined, blocked, and invalid. See understanding declines for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsBacsDebit.Fingerprint
member.summary: Uniquely identifies this particular bank account. You can use this attribute to check whether two bank accounts are the same.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsBacsDebit.Last4
member.summary: Last four digits of the bank account number.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsBacsDebit.Mandate
member.summary: ID of the mandate used to make this payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsBacsDebit.SortCode

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCard.ExpMonth

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargePaymentMethodDetailsCard.ExpYear

member.summary: The Stripe account ID for which these funds are intended.

member.summary: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary: Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent’s payment method. If present, the payment method used with this PaymentIntent can be attached to a Customer, even after the transaction completes. Use on_session if you intend to only reuse the payment method when your customer is present in your checkout flow. Use off_session if your customer may or may not be in your checkout flow. Stripe uses this to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules. For example, if your customer is impacted by SCA, using off_session will ensure that they are authenticated while processing this PaymentIntent. You will then be able to make later off-session payments for this customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for this payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about the payment. This will appear on your customer’s statement when this payment succeeds in creating a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.TransferData
member.summary: The parameters used to automatically create a Transfer when the payment succeeds.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies the resulting payment as part of a group. See the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentTransferDataOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount that will be transferred automatically when a charge succeeds.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: If specified, successful charges will be attributed to the destination account for tax reporting, and the funds from charges will be transferred to the destination account. The ID of the resulting transfer will be returned on the successful charge’s field.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner’s Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key in order to set an application fee percentage. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Balance
member.summary: Current balance, if any, being stored on the customer. If negative, the customer has credit to apply to their next invoice. If positive, the customer has an amount owed that will be added to their next invoice. The balance does not refer to any unpaid invoices; it solely takes into account amounts that have yet to be successfully applied to any invoice. This balance is only taken into account as invoices are finalized.

member.summary: is the raw JSON data of the response that was used to initialize this ephemeral key. When working with mobile clients that might only understand one version of the API you should prefer to send this value back to them so that they'll be able to decode an object that's current according to their version.

member.summary: Number of webhooks that have yet to be successfully delivered (i.e., to return a 20x response) to the URLs you’ve specified.

member.summary: Information on the API request that instigated the event.

member.summary: Object containing the API resource relevant to the event. For example, an invoice.created event will have a full invoice object () as the value of the object key.

member.summary: Object containing the names of the attributes that have changed, and their previous values (sent along only with *.updated events).

member.name: P:Stripe.EventData.RawObject
member.summary: This contains the same data as , but untyped. This is occasionally useful, e.g. when working with an API resource for which the Stripe.net library does not have a concrete type.

member.name: P:Stripe.EventRequest.Id
member.summary: ID of the API request that caused the event. If null, the event was automatic (e.g., Stripe’s automatic subscription handling). Request logs are available in the dashboard, but currently not in the API.

member.name: P:Stripe.EventRequest.IdempotencyKey
member.summary: The idempotency key transmitted during the request, if any.
member.remarks: Note: This property is populated only for events on or after May 23, 2017.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.summary: String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AccountCountry
member.summary: The country of the business associated with this invoice, most often the business creating the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AccountName
member.summary: The public name of the business associated with this invoice, most often the business creating the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AmountDue
member.summary: Final amount due at this time for this invoice. If the invoice's total is smaller than the minimum charge amount, for example, or if there is account credit that can be applied to the invoice, the may be 0. If there is a positive for the invoice (the customer owes money), the will also take that into account. The charge that gets generated for the invoice will be for the amount specified in .

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AmountPaid
member.summary: The amount that was paid.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AmountRemaining
member.summary: The amount that was paid.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The fee in that will be applied to the invoice and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account when the invoice is paid.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AttemptCount
member.summary: Number of payment attempts made for this invoice, from the perspective of the payment retry schedule. Any payment attempt counts as the first attempt, and subsequently only automatic retries increment the attempt count. In other words, manual payment attempts after the first attempt do not affect the retry schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Attempted
member.summary: Whether an attempt has been made to pay the invoice. An invoice is not attempted until 1 hour after the invoice.created webhook, for example, so you might not want to display that invoice as unpaid to your users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AutoAdvance
member.summary: Controls whether Stripe will perform automatic collection of the invoice. When false, the invoice's state will not automatically advance without an explicit action.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.BillingReason
member.summary: Indicates the reason why the invoice was created. One of automatic_pending_invoice_item_invoice, manual, subscription, subscription_create, subscription_cycle, subscription_threshold, subscription_update, or upcoming.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.ChargeId
member.summary: ID of the latest charge generated for this invoice, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Charge
member.summary: (Expanded) The latest charge generated for this invoice, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this invoice using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email this invoice to the customer with payment instructions. Defaults to charge_automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomFields
member.summary: Custom fields displayed on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerId
member.summary: The ID of the customer who will be billed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Customer
member.summary: (Expanded) T)he customer who will be billed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerAddress
member.summary: The customer’s address. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal . Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerEmail
member.summary: The customer’s email. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal . Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerName
member.summary: The customer’s name. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal . Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerPhone
member.summary: The customer’s phone number. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal . Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerShipping
member.summary: The customer’s shipping information. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal . Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerTaxExempt
member.summary: The customer’s tax exempt status. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal . Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerTaxIds
member.summary: The customer’s tax ids. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal . Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DefaultPaymentMethodId
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice and be in a chargeable state. If not set, defaults to the subscription’s default payment method, if any, or to the customer’s default payment method.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: (Expanded) The default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice and be in a chargeable state. If not set, defaults to the subscription’s default payment method, if any, or to the customer’s default payment method.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: Tax rates applied to the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users. Referenced as 'memo' in the Dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Discount
member.summary: Describes the current discount applied to this invoice, if there is one.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DueDate
member.summary: The date on which payment for this invoice is due. This value will be null for invoices where billing=charge_automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.EndingBalance
member.summary: Ending customer balance after the invoice is finalized. Invoices are finalized approximately an hour after successful webhook delivery or when payment collection is attempted for the invoice. If the invoice has not been finalized yet, this will be null.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Footer
member.summary: Footer displayed on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.HostedInvoiceUrl
member.summary: The URL for the hosted invoice page, which allows customers to view and pay an invoice. If the invoice has not been finalized yet, this will be null.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.InvoicePdf
member.summary: The link to download the PDF for the invoice. If the invoice has not been finalized yet, this will be null.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Lines
member.summary: The individual line items that make up the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.NextPaymentAttempt
member.summary: The time at which payment will next be attempted. This value will be null for invoices where is set to send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Number
member.summary: A unique, identifying string that appears on emails sent to the customer for this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Paid
member.summary: Whether payment was successfully collected for this invoice. An invoice can be paid (most commonly) with a charge or with credit from the customer's account balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.PaymentIntentId
member.summary: ID of the PaymentIntent associated with this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.PaymentIntent
member.summary: (Expanded) The PaymentIntent associated with this invoice. The PaymentIntent is generated when the invoice is finalized, and can then be used to pay the invoice. Note that voiding an invoice will cancel the PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.PeriodEnd
member.summary: End of the usage period during which invoice items were added to this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.PeriodStart
member.summary: Start of the usage period during which invoice items were added to this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Subtotal
member.summary: Total of all subscriptions, invoice items, and prorations on the invoice before any discount or tax is applied.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Total
member.summary: Total after discounts and taxes.

member.summary: If specified, the funds from the invoice will be transferred to the destination and the ID of the resulting transfer will be found on the invoice's charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.WebhooksDeliveredAt
member.summary: Invoices are automatically paid or sent 1 hour after webhooks are delivered, or until all webhook delivery attempts have been exhausted. This field tracks the time when webhooks for this invoice were successfully delivered. If the invoice had no webhooks to deliver, this will be set while the invoice is being created.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthDeauthorize.StripeUserId
member.summary: The unique id of the account you have revoked access to, as a string. This is the same as the you passed in. If this is returned, the revocation was successful.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.AccessToken

summary.para: The access token you can use to make requests on behalf of this Stripe account. Use it as you would any Stripe secret API key.
This key does not expire, but may be revoked by the user at any time (you'll get a account.application.deauthorized webhook event when this happens).

member.remarks: This property is deprecated. In backend code, it is recommended that you use your own secret key in conjunction with the connected account's ID found in .

summary.para: The live mode indicator for the token. If true, the can be used as a live secret key. If false, the can be used as a test secret key.
Depends on the mode of the secret API key used to make the request.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.RefreshToken
member.summary: Can be used to get a new access token of an equal or lesser scope, or of a different live mode (where applicable).
member.remarks: This property is deprecated. In backend code, it is recommended that you don't use access tokens or refresh tokens at all. Instead, you should use your own secret key in conjunction with the connected account's ID found in .

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.Scope
member.summary: The scope granted to the access token, depending on the scope of the authorization code and scope parameter.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.StripePublishableKey
member.summary: A publishable key that can be used with this account. Matches the mode—live or test—of the token.
member.remarks: This property is deprecated. In frontend code, it is recommended that you use your own publishable key in conjunction with the connected account's ID found in .

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.StripeUserId
member.summary: The unique id of the account you have been granted access to, as a string.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.TokenType
member.summary: Will always have a value of bearer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Order.SelectedShippingMethod
member.summary: The shipping method that is currently selected for this order, if any. If present, it is equal to one of the ids of shipping methods in the shipping_methods array. At order creation time, if there are multiple shipping methods, Stripe will automatically selected the first method.

member.name: P:Stripe.Order.Shipping
member.summary: The shipping address for the order. Present if the order is for goods to be shipped.

member.name: P:Stripe.Order.ShippingMethods
member.summary: A list of supported shipping methods for this order. The desired shipping method can be specified either by updating the order, or when paying it.

member.summary: Current order status. One of created, paid, canceled, fulfilled, or returned.

member.summary: The timestamps at which the order status was updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderItem.Description
member.summary: Description of the line item, meant to be displayable to the user (e.g., "Express shipping").

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderItem.ParentId
member.summary: ID of the parent associated with this order item.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderItem.Quantity
member.summary: A positive integer representing the number of instances of parent that are included in this order item. Applicable/present only if type is sku.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderItem.Type
member.summary: The type of line item. One of sku, tax, shipping, or discount.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderShippingMethod.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (that is, 100 cents for $1.00, or 1 for ¥1, Japanese Yen being a 0-decimal currency) representing the total amount for the line item.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderShippingMethod.Currency
member.summary: 3-letter ISO code representing the currency of the line item.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderShippingMethod.DeliveryEstimate
member.summary: The estimated delivery date for the given shipping method. Can be either a specific date or a range.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderShippingMethod.Description
member.summary: Description of the line item, meant to be displayable to the user (e.g., "Express shipping").

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderShippingMethodDeliveryEstimate.Date
member.summary: If type is "exact", date will be the expected delivery date in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderShippingMethodDeliveryEstimate.Earliest
member.summary: If type is "range", earliest will be be the earliest delivery date in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderShippingMethodDeliveryEstimate.Latest
member.summary: If type is "range", latest will be the latest delivery date in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderShippingMethodDeliveryEstimate.Type
member.summary: The type of estimate. Must be either "range" or "exact".

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Object
member.summary: String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.AmountCapturable
member.summary: Amount that can be captured from this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.AmountReceived
member.summary: Amount that was collected by this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.ApplicationId
member.summary: ID of the Connect application that created the PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) for the resulting payment. See the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.CanceledAt
member.summary: Populated when status is canceled, this is the time at which the PaymentIntent was canceled. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.CancellationReason
member.summary: Reason for cancellation of this PaymentIntent, either user-provided (duplicate, fraudulent, requested_by_customer, or abandoned) or generated by Stripe internally (failed_invoice, void_invoice, or automatic).

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.CaptureMethod
member.summary: One of automatic (default) or manual. When the capture method is automatic, Stripe automatically captures funds when the customer authorizes the payment. Change the capture method to manual if you wish to separate authorization and capture for payment methods that support this.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Charges
member.summary: Charges that were created by this PaymentIntent, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.ClientSecret
member.summary: The client secret of this PaymentIntent. Used for client-side retrieval using a publishable key. The client secret can be used to complete a payment from your frontend. It should not be stored, logged, embedded in URLs, or exposed to anyone other than the customer. Make sure that you have TLS enabled on any page that includes the client secret. Please refer to our automatic confirmation quickstart guide to learn about how client_secret should be handled.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.ConfirmationMethod
member.summary: One of automatic (default) or manual. When the confirmation method is automatic, a PaymentIntent can be confirmed using a publishable key. After next actions are handled, no additional confirmation is required to complete the payment. When the confirmation method is manual, all payment attempts must be made using a secret key. The PaymentIntent returns to the requires_confirmation state after handling next_actions, and requires your server to initiate each payment attempt with an explicit confirmation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.CustomerId
member.summary: ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists. If present, payment methods used with this PaymentIntent can only be attached to this Customer, and payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.InvoiceId
member.summary: ID of the invoice that created this PaymentIntent, if one exists.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.LastPaymentError
member.summary: The payment error encountered in the previous PaymentIntent confirmation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an order object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.NextAction
member.summary: If present, this property tells you what actions you need to take in order for your customer to fulfill a payment using the provided source.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.OnBehalfOfId
member.summary: The account (if any) for which the funds of the PaymentIntent are intended. See the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.PaymentMethodId
member.summary: ID of the payment method used in this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types (e.g. card) that this PaymentIntent is allowed to use.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.ReviewId
member.summary: ID of the review associated with this PaymentIntent, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary: Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent’s payment method. If present, the payment method used with this PaymentIntent can be attached to a Customer, even after the transaction completes. Use on_session if you intend to only reuse the payment method when your customer is present in your checkout flow. Use off_session if your customer may or may not be in your checkout flow. Stripe uses this to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules. For example, if your customer is impacted by SCA, using off_session will ensure that they are authenticated while processing this PaymentIntent. You will then be able to make later off-session payments for this customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.SourceId
member.summary: ID of the Source associated with this PaymentIntent, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a PaymentIntent. This will appear on your customer’s statement when this PaymentIntent succeeds in creating a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Status
member.summary: Status of this PaymentIntent, one of requires_payment_method, requires_confirmation, requires_action, processing, requires_capture, canceled, or succeeded. Read more about each PaymentIntent status.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.TransferData
member.summary: The data with which to automatically create a Transfer when the payment is finalized. See the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies the resulting payment as part of a group. See the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentNextAction.RedirectToUrl
member.summary: Contains instructions for authenticating a payment by redirecting your customer to another page or application.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentNextAction.Type
member.summary: Type of the next action to perform, one of redirect_to_url or use_stripe_sdk.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentNextActionRedirectToUrl.ReturnUrl
member.summary: If the customer does not exit their browser while authenticating, they will be redirected to this specified URL after completion.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentNextActionRedirectToUrl.Url
member.summary: The URL you must redirect your customer to in order to authenticate the payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptions.Bancontact
member.summary: Configuration specific to Bancontact for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptions.Card
member.summary: If the PaymentIntent’s supported payment method types include card, this hash contains the configurations that will be applied to each payment attempt of that type.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsBancontact.PreferredLanguage
member.summary: Preferred language of the Bancontact authorization page that the customer is redirected to.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCard.Installments
member.summary: Installment details for this payment (Mexico only).

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCard.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request authentication based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Permitted values include: automatic, any, or challenge_only.

member.summary: Installment plans that may be selected for this PaymentIntent.

member.summary: Whether Installments are enabled for this PaymentIntent.

member.summary: Installment plan selected for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsPlan.Count
member.summary: For fixed_count installment plans, this is the number of installment payments your customer will make to their credit card.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsPlan.Interval
member.summary: For fixed_count installment plans, this is the interval between installment payments your customer will make to their credit card.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsPlan.Type
member.summary: Type of installment plan, one of fixed_count.

member.summary: Whether the person is a director of the account’s legal entity..

member.summary: Whether the person is an owner of the account’s legal entity..

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.PercentOwnership
member.summary: The percent owned by the person of the account’s legal entity.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.Representative
member.summary: Whether the person is authorized as the primary representative of the account. This is the person nominated by the business to provide information about themselves, and general information about the account. There can only be one representative at any given time. At the time the account is created, this person should be set to the person responsible for opening the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.Title
member.summary: The person’s title (e.g., CEO, Support Engineer).

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected to keep the person’s account enabled. If not collected by the account’s current_deadline, these fields are moved to past_due and the account is disabled.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.Errors
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected again because validation or verification failed for some reason.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As fields are needed, they are moved to currently_due and the account’s current_deadline is set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: Fields that weren’t collected by the account’s current_deadline. These fields need to be collected to enable payouts for the person’s account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.PendingVerification
member.summary: Additional fields that may be required depending on the results of verification or review for provided requirements. If any of these fields become required, they appear in or .

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerification.AdditionalDocument
member.summary: A document showing address, either a passport, local ID card, or utility bill from a well-known utility company.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerification.Details
member.summary: A user-displayable string describing the verification state for this person. For example, if a document is uploaded and the picture is too fuzzy, this may say “Identity document is too unclear to read”.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerification.DetailsCode
member.summary: A machine-readable code specifying the verification state for this person. One of document_name_mismatch, failed_keyed_identity, or failed_other.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerification.Document
member.summary: An identifying document for this individual, either a passport or local ID card.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerification.Status
member.summary: The state of verification for this person. Possible values are unverified, pending, or verified.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Object
member.summary: String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Active
member.summary: Whether the plan is currently available for new subscriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.AggregateUsage
member.summary: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for plans where is metered. Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for picking the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for picking the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which picks the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Amount
member.summary: The amount in cents to be charged on the interval specified.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.AmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as , but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.BillingScheme
member.summary: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in amount) will be charged per unit in quantity (for plans with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for plans with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the and attributes.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Interval
member.summary: One of day, week, month or year. The frequency with which a subscription should be billed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals (specified in the interval property) between subscription billings.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a subscription object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the plan, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.ProductId
member.summary: ID of the product linked to this plan.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Product
member.summary: The product linked to this plan (if it was expanded).

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Tiers
member.summary: Each element represents a pricing tier. This parameter requires to be set to tiered.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.TiersMode
member.summary: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price, in graduated tiering pricing can successively change as the quantity grows.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.TransformUsage
member.summary: Apply a transformation to the reported usage or set quantity before computing the billed price. Cannot be combined with .

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this plan using trial_from_plan=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.UsageType
member.summary: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined, can be either metered or licensed. licensed will automatically bill the quantity set for a plan when adding it to a subscription, metered will aggregate the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to licensed.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.FlatAmount
member.summary: Price for the entire tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.FlatAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as , but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.UnitAmount
member.summary: Per unit price for units relevant to the tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as , but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.UpTo

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.BillingScheme
member.summary: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in or will be charged per unit in quantity (for prices with set to licensed), or per unit of total usage (for prices with set to metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the and attributes.

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.Currency

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.Product
member.summary: (Expanded) The product linked to this price (if it was expanded).

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.Recurring
member.summary: The recurring components of a price such as its interval.

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.Tiers
member.summary: Each element represents a pricing tier. This parameter requires to be set to tiered.

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.TiersMode
member.summary: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price, in graduated tiering pricing can successively change as the quantity grows.

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.TransformQuantity
member.summary: Apply a transformation to the reported usage or set quantity before computing the billed price. Cannot be combined with .

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.Type
member.summary: One of one_time or recurring depending on whether the price is for a one-time purchase or a recurring (subscription) purchase.

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.UnitAmount
member.summary: The amount in cents to be charged on the interval specified.

member.name: P:Stripe.Price.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as , but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurring.AggregateUsage
member.summary: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for prices where is metered. Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for picking the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for picking the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which picks the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurring.Interval
member.summary: he frequency at which a subscription is billed. One of day, week, month or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurring.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals (specified in the property) between subscription billings.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurring.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this price using trial_from_price=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurring.UsageType
member.summary: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined, can be either metered or licensed. licensed will automatically bill the quantity set for a price when adding it to a subscription, metered will aggregate the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to licensed.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTier.FlatAmount
member.summary: Price for the entire tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTier.FlatAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as , but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTier.UnitAmount
member.summary: Per unit price for units relevant to the tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTier.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as , but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTier.UpTo
member.summary: Up to and including to this quantity will be contained in the tier.

member.summary: Divide usage by this number.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceTransformQuantity.Round
member.summary: After division, either round the result up or down.

summary.para: The client secret of this SetupIntent. Used for client-side retrieval using a publishable key.

The client secret can be used to complete payment setup from your frontend. It should not be stored, logged, embedded in URLs, or exposed to anyone other than the customer. Make sure that you have TLS enabled on any page that includes the client secret.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.CustomerId
member.summary: ID of the Customer this SetupIntent belongs to, if one exists. If present, payment methods used with this SetupIntent can only be attached to this Customer, and payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this SetupIntent.

member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.summary: ID of the multi-use Mandate generated by the SetupIntent.

member.summary: If present, this property tells you what actions you need to take in order for your customer to continue payment setup.

member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration for this SetupIntent.

member.summary: ID of the single-use Mandate generated by the SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.Status
member.summary: Status of this SetupIntent, one of requires_payment_method, requires_confirmation, requires_action, processing, canceled, or succeeded.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.Usage
member.summary: Indicates how the payment method is intended to be used in the future. Use on_session if you intend to only reuse the payment method when the customer is in your checkout flow. Use off_session if your customer may or may not be in your checkout flow. If not provided, this value defaults to off_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentPaymentMethodOptions.Card
member.summary: If the SetupIntent’s payment method types include card, this hash contains the configurations that will be applied to each setup attempt of that type.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCard.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request authentication based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Permitted values include: automatic, any, or challenge_only.

member.name: T:Stripe.Source
member.summary: Source objects allow you to accept a variety of payment methods. They represent a customer's payment instrument and can be used with the Source API just like a card object: once chargeable, they can be charged, or attached to customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Object
member.summary: String representing the object’s type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Amount
member.summary: Amount associated with the source. This is the amount for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for single-use sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.ClientSecret
member.summary: The client secret of the source. Used for client-side polling using a publishable key.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.CodeVerification
member.summary: Information related to the code verification flow. Present if the source is authenticated by a verification code (flow is code_verification).

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Currency
member.summary: The currency associated with the source. This is the currency for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for single-use sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Customer
member.summary: The customer to which the source is attached, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Flow
member.summary: The authentication flow of the source. Flow is one of redirect, receiver, code_verification, none.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an order object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Owner
member.summary: Information about the owner of the payment instrument that may be used or required by particular source types.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Receiver
member.summary: Information related to the receiver flow. Present if the source is a receiver (flow is receiver).

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Redirect
member.summary: Information related to the redirect flow. Present if the source is authenticated by a redirect (flow is redirect).

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.SourceOrder
member.summary: Information about the items and shipping associated with the source. Required for transactional credit (for example Klarna) sources before you can charge it.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a source. This will appear on your customer’s statement every time you charge the source.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Status
member.summary: The status of the charge, one of canceled, chargeable, consumed, failed, or pending. Only chargeable source objects can be used to create a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Type
member.summary: The type of the source. The type is a payment method, one of card, three_d_secure, giropay, sepa_debit, ideal, klarna, sofort, or bancontact.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Usage
member.summary: One of reusable, single-use. Whether this source should be reusable or not. Some source types may or may not be reusable by construction, while other may leave the option at creation. If an incompatible value is passed, an error will be returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCodeVerification.AttemptsRemaining
member.summary: The number of attempts remaining to authenticate the source object with a verification code.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCodeVerification.Status
member.summary: The status of the code verification, either pending, succeeded or failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceOwner.Name

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.Address
member.summary: The address of the receiver source. This is the value that should be communicated to the customer to send their funds to.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.AmountCharged
member.summary: The total amount charged by you. The amount charged is expressed in the source’s currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.AmountReceived
member.summary: The total amount received by the receiver source. AmountReceived = AmountReturned + AmountCharged is true at all times. The amount received is expressed in the source’s currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.AmountReturned

member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given value. The value can be basically anything, as long as it can be encoded in some way.

The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.

member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given instance.
