The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.
member.returns: The list of parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.FlattenParamsOptions(Stripe.INestedOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given options class. If a key prefix is provided, the keys for the new parameters will be nested under the key prefix. E.g. if the key prefix `foo` is passed and the options class contains a parameter `bar`, then a parameter with key `foo[bar]` will be returned.
member.param: The options class for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.
member.returns: The list of parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.FlattenParamsDictionary(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given dictionary. If a key prefix is provided, the keys for the new parameters will be nested under the key prefix. E.g. if the key prefix `foo` is passed and the dictionary contains a key `bar`, then a parameter with key `foo[bar]` will be returned.
member.param: The dictionary for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.
member.returns: The list of parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.FlattenParamsList(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given list of objects. The parameter keys will be indexed under the `keyPrefix` parameter. E.g. if the `keyPrefix` is `foo`, then the key for the first element's will be `foo[0]`, etc.
member.param: The list for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested.
member.returns: The list of parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.SingleParam(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a list containing a single parameter.
member.returns: A list containg the single parameter.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.NewPrefix(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Computes the new key prefix, given a key and an existing prefix (if any). E.g. if the key is `bar` and the existing prefix is `foo`, then `foo[bar]` is returned. If a key already contains nested values, then only the non-nested part is nested under the prefix, e.g. if the key is `bar[baz]` and the prefix is `foo`, then `foo[bar][baz]` is returned. If no prefix is provided, the key is returned unchanged.
member.param: The existing key prefix, if any.
member.returns: The new key prefix.

member.name: T:Stripe.Infrastructure.StripeObjectConverter
member.summary: This converter can be used to deserialize any Stripe object. It is mainly useful for polymorphic attributes, when the property's type is an interface instead of a concrete type. In this case, the converter will use the value of the `object` key in the JSON payload to decide which concrete type to instantiate. If no concrete type is found (or if one is found, but it's not compatible with the expected interface), then the converter returns `null`.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeConfiguration.SerializerSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the settings used for deserializing JSON objects returned by Stripe's API. It is highly recommended you do not change these settings, as doing so can produce unexpected results. If you do change these settings, make sure that is among the converters, otherwise Stripe.net will no longer be able to deserialize polymorphic resources represented by interfaces (e.g. ).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Country
member.summary: The country in which the account holder resides, or in which the business is legally established. This should be an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. For example, if you are in the United States and the business for which you’re creating an account is legally represented in Canada, you would use CA as the country for the account being created.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.DefaultCurrency

summary.para: A card or bank account to attach to the account. You can provide either a token, like the ones returned by Stripe.js, or a or instance.

By default, providing an external account sets it as the new default external account for its currency, and deletes the old default if one exists. To add additional external accounts without replacing the existing default for the currency, use the bank account or card creation API.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount to capture on the authorization.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.ApplicationFee
member.summary: This is deprecated in favor of ApplicationFeeAmount.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: A fee in cents that will be applied to the charge and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. To use an application fee, the request must be made on behalf of another account (using RequestOptions available on all service methods), using the Stripe-Account header, an OAuth key, or the destination parameter. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.Destination
member.summary: An optional dictionary containing a new destination amount to use. Can only be used with destination charges created with Stripe Connect.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: Email address that will receive an email receipt confirming the transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer's credit card statement. This may be up to 22 characters. As an example, if your website is RunClub and the item you're charging for is a race ticket, you may want to specify a statement_descriptor of RunClub 5K race ticket. The statement description may not include <>"' characters, and will appear on your customer's statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped. While most banks display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a 0-decimal currency) representing how much to charge the card. The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: A fee in cents that will be applied to the charge and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. To use an application fee, the request must be made on behalf of another account (using RequestOptions available on all service methods), using the Stripe-Account header, an OAuth key, or the destination parameter. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Capture
member.summary: Whether or not to immediately capture the charge. When false, the charge issues an authorization (or pre-authorization), and will need to be captured later. Uncaptured charges expire in 7 days. For more information, see authorizing charges and settling later.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: 3-letter ISO code for currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer that will be charged in this request.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a charge object. It is displayed when in the web interface alongside the charge. Note that if you use Stripe to send automatic email receipts to your customers, your receipt emails will include the description of the charge(s) that they are describing.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Destination
member.summary: If specified, the charge will be attributed to the destination account for tax reporting, and the funds from the charge will be transferred to the destination account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Level3
member.summary: Extra information about the charge passing level III data to card networks.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a charge object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. It's often a good idea to store an email address in metadata for tracking later.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The Stripe account ID that these funds are intended for. Automatically set if you use the destination parameter. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: The email address to send this charge's receipt to. The receipt will not be sent until the charge is paid. If this charge is for a customer, the email address specified here will override the customer's email address. Receipts will not be sent for test mode charges. If receipt_email is specified for a charge in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your email settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for the charge. Helps prevent fraud on charges for physical goods. For more information, see the Charge object documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Source
member.summary: A payment source to be charged. This can be the ID of a card (i.e., credit or debit card), a bank account, a source, a token, or a connected account. For certain sources—namely, cards, bank accounts, and attached sources—you must also pass the ID of the associated customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer's credit card statement. This may be up to 22 characters. As an example, if your website is RunClub and the item you're charging for is a race ticket, you may want to specify a statement_descriptor of RunClub 5K race ticket. The statement description may not include <>"' characters, and will appear on your customer's statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped. While most banks display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. For details, see Grouping transactions.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeDestinationCreateOptions.Account
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeDestinationOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount to transfer to the destination account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeFraudDetailsOptions.UserReport
member.summary: Either safe or fraudulent.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeListOptions.Customer
member.summary: Only return charges for the customer specified by this customer ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeListOptions.PaymentIntent
member.summary: Only return charges that were created by the PaymentIntent specified by this PaymentIntent ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeListOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: Only return charges for this transfer group.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer that will be associated with this charge. This field may only be updated if there is no existing associated customer with this charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a charge object. It is displayed when in the web interface alongside the charge. Note that if you use Stripe to send automatic email receipts to your customers, your receipt emails will include the description of the charge(s) that they are describing.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.FraudDetails
member.summary: Stripe will use the information you send to improve our fraud detection algorithms.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: A This is the email address that the receipt for this charge will be sent to. If this field is updated, then a new email receipt will be sent to the updated address.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for the charge. Helps prevent fraud on charges for physical goods. For more information, see the Charge object documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. transfer_group may only be provided if it has not been set. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCreateOptions.Address
member.summary: The customer’s address.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCreateOptions.Balance
member.summary: Current balance, if any, being stored on the customer. If negative, the customer has credit to apply to their next invoice. If positive, the customer has an amount owed that will be added to their next invoice. The balance does not refer to any unpaid invoices; it solely takes into account amounts that have yet to be successfully applied to any invoice. This balance is only taken into account as invoices are finalized.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCreateOptions.Name
member.summary: The customer’s full name or business name.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCreateOptions.NextInvoiceSequence
member.summary: The suffix of the customer’s next invoice number.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCreateOptions.Phone
member.summary: The customer’s phone number.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCreateOptions.PreferredLocales
member.summary: The customer’s preferred locales (languages), ordered by preference.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCreateOptions.Source
member.summary: The source can either be a Token or a Source, as returned by Elements, or a containing a user’s credit card details. You must provide a source if the customer does not already have a valid source attached, and you are subscribing the customer to be charged automatically for a plan that is not free. Passing source will create a new source object, make it the customer default source, and delete the old customer default if one exists. If you want to add an additional source, instead use to add the card and then to set it as the default. Whenever you attach a card to a customer, Stripe will automatically validate the card.

member.summary: Describes the customer’s tax exemption status. One of none, exempt, or reverse.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeUpdateOptions.Evidence
member.summary: Evidence to upload, to respond to a dispute. Updating any field in the hash will submit all fields in the hash for review. The combined character count of all fields is limited to 150,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a charge object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. It's often a good idea to store an email address in metadata for tracking later.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeUpdateOptions.Submit
member.summary: Whether to immediately submit evidence to the bank. If false, evidence is staged on the dispute. Staged evidence is visible in the API and Dashboard, and can be submitted to the bank by making another request with this attribute set to true (the default).

member.name: T:Stripe.EventUtility
member.summary: This class contains utility methods to process event objects in Stripe's webhooks.

member.name: M:Stripe.EventUtility.ParseEvent(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses a JSON string from a Stripe webhook into a object.
member.returns: The deserialized .
member.exception: Thrown if the API version of the event doesn't match Stripe.net's default API version.
member.remarks: This method doesn't verify webhook signatures. It's recommended that you use instead.

member.name: M:Stripe.EventUtility.ConstructEvent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses a JSON string from a Stripe webhook into a object, while verifying the webhook's signature.
member.param: The value of the Stripe-Signature header from the webhook request.
member.returns: The deserialized .
member.exception: Thrown if the signature verification fails for any reason, of if the API version of the event doesn't match Stripe.net's default API version.

member.name: M:Stripe.EventUtility.ConstructEvent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses a JSON string from a Stripe webhook into a object, while verifying the webhook's signature.
member.param: The value of the Stripe-Signature header from the webhook request.
The timestamp to use for the current time.
member.returns: The deserialized .
member.exception: Thrown if the signature verification fails for any reason, of if the API version of the event doesn't match Stripe.net's default API version.

member.summary: The ID of a subscription to add this invoice item to. When left blank, the invoice item will be be added to the next upcoming scheduled invoice. When set, scheduled invoices for subscriptions other than the specified subscription will ignore the invoice item. Use this when you want to express that an invoice item has been accrued within the context of a particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: A fee in cents that will be applied to the invoice and transferred to the application owner’s Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key or the Stripe-Account header in order to take an application fee. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this invoice using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email this invoice to the customer with payment instructions. Defaults to charge_automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Footer
member.summary: Footer to be displayed on the invoice. This can be unset by updating the value to null and then saving.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a charge for the customer’s credit card statement. It must contain at least one letter. If not specified and this invoice is part of a subscription, the default statement_descriptor will be set to the first subscription item’s product’s statement_descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Subscription
member.summary: The ID of the subscription to invoice. If not set, the created invoice will include all pending invoice items for the customer. If set, the created invoice will exclude pending invoice items that pertain to other subscriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.TaxPercent
member.summary: The percent tax rate applied to the invoice, represented as a decimal number.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPeriodOptions.End
member.summary: The end of the period, which must be greater than or equal to the start.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPeriodOptions.Start
member.summary: he start of the period.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.Product
member.summary: The ID of the product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The amount in cents to be charged on the interval specified.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as , but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceListOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceListOptions.Created
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object created field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceListOptions.Customer
member.summary: Only return invoices for the customer specified by this customer ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceListOptions.DueDate
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object due_date field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceListOptions.Paid
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object paid field.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceListOptions.Status
member.summary: Only return invoices with a given status. Must be one of draft, open, paid, uncollectible, or void.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceListOptions.Subscription
member.summary: Only return invoices for the subscription specified by this subscription ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.PaidOutOfBand
member.summary: Boolean representing whether an invoice is paid outside of Stripe. This will result in no charge being made.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.OffSession
member.summary: Indicates if a customer is on session while an invoice payment is attempted.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.PaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the payment method to use for paying the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Id
member.summary: Subscription item to update.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.ClearUsage
member.summary: Delete all usage for a given subscription item. Only allowed when deleted is set to true and the current plan’s usage_type is metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Deleted
member.summary: A flag that, if set to true, will delete the specified item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a charge object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. It's often a good idea to store an email address in metadata for tracking later.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Plan
member.summary: Plan ID for this item, as a string.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether the invoice returned would preview cancelling the subscription immediately.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: A list of Tax Rate ids. These Tax Rates will override the default_tax_rates on the Subscription. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined tax rates.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceTransferDataOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount that will be transferred automatically when the invoice is paid. If no amount is set, the full amount is transferred.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: The account where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.Amount
member.summary: The integer amount in cents of previewed invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency. Only applicable to new invoice items.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to the invoice item. The description is displayed in the invoice for easy tracking.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.Discountable
member.summary: Controls whether discounts apply to this invoice item. Defaults to false for prorations or negative invoice items, and true for all other invoice items.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.InvoiceItem
member.summary: Ids of the tax rates to apply to this invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.Period
member.summary: The period associated with this invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Non-negative integer. The quantity of units for the invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates which apply to the invoice item. When set, the on the invoice do not apply to this invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The integer unit amount in cents of the charge to be applied to the upcoming invoice. This value will be multiplied by the quantity to get the full amount. If you want to apply a credit to the customer’s account, pass a negative value.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpcomingInvoiceItemOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as , but accepts a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: A fee in cents that will be applied to the invoice and transferred to the application owner’s Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key or the Stripe-Account header in order to take an application fee. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically or send_invoice. This field can be updated only on draft invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.CustomFields
member.summary: A list of up to 4 custom fields to be displayed on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: The number of days from which the invoice is created until it is due. Only valid for invoices where billing=send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: Ids of the tax rates to apply to this subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DueDate
member.summary: The date on which payment for this invoice is due. Only valid for invoices where billing=send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.Footer
member.summary: Footer to be displayed on the invoice. This can be unset by updating the value to null and then saving.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.Coupon
member.summary: The code of the coupon to apply. If subscription or subscription_items is provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with that coupon. Otherwise, it will preview applying that coupon to the customer for the next upcoming invoice from among the customer’s subscriptions. The invoice can be previewed without a coupon by passing this value as an empty string.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.Customer
member.summary: REQUIRED.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.InvoiceItems
member.summary: List of invoice items to add or update in the upcoming invoice preview.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.Schedule
member.summary: The identifier of the unstarted schedule whose upcoming invoice you’d like to retrieve. Cannot be used with subscription or subscription fields.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionBillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: For new subscriptions, a future to anchor the subscription’s billing cycle. This is used to determine the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices. For existing subscriptions, the value can only be set to one of .

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionCancelAt
member.summary: Time at which the subscription would cancel.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionCancelAtPeriodEnd
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether this subscription should cancel at the end of the current period.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionCancelNow
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether the invoice returned would preview cancelling the subscription immediately.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionDefaultTaxRates
member.summary: If provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with those tax rates applied.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.Subscription
member.summary: The identifier of the subscription for which you’d like to retrieve the upcoming invoice. If not provided, but a subscription_items is provided, you will preview creating a subscription with those items. If neither subscription nor subscription_items is provided, you will retrieve the next upcoming invoice from among the customer’s subscriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionItems
member.summary: List of subscription items, each with an attached plan.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionProrate
member.summary: If previewing an update to a subscription, this decides whether the preview will show the result of applying prorations or not. If set, one of subscription_items or subscription, and one of subscription_items or subscription_trial_end are required.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionProrationDate
member.summary: If previewing an update to a subscription, and doing proration, subscription_proration_date forces the proration to be calculated as though the update was done at the specified time. The time given must be within the current subscription period, and cannot be before the subscription was on its current plan. If set, subscription, and one of subscription_items, or subscription_trial_end are required. Also, subscription_proration cannot be set to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionTaxPercent
member.summary: If provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with that tax percent. If set, one of subscription_items or subscription is required.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionTrialEnd
member.summary: If provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with that trial end. If set, one of subscription_items or subscription is required.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceListLineItemsOptions.SubscriptionTrialFromPlan
member.summary: Indicates if a plan’s trial_period_days should be applied to the subscription. Setting subscription_trial_end per subscription is preferred, and this defaults to false. Setting this flag to true together with subscription_trial_end is not allowed.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.Coupon
member.summary: The code of the coupon to apply. If subscription or subscription_items is provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with that coupon. Otherwise, it will preview applying that coupon to the customer for the next upcoming invoice from among the customer’s subscriptions. The invoice can be previewed without a coupon by passing this value as an empty string.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.Customer
member.summary: REQUIRED.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.InvoiceItems
member.summary: List of invoice items to add or update in the upcoming invoice preview.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.Schedule
member.summary: The identifier of the unstarted schedule whose upcoming invoice you’d like to retrieve. Cannot be used with subscription or subscription fields.

member.summary: For new subscriptions, a future to anchor the subscription’s billing cycle. This is used to determine the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices. For existing subscriptions, the value can only be set to one of .

member.summary: Time at which the subscription would cancel.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.SubscriptionCancelAtPeriodEnd
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether this subscription should cancel at the end of the current period.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.SubscriptionCancelNow
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether the invoice returned would preview cancelling the subscription immediately.

member.summary: If provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with those tax rates applied.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.Subscription
member.summary: The identifier of the subscription for which you’d like to retrieve the upcoming invoice. If not provided, but a subscription_items is provided, you will preview creating a subscription with those items. If neither subscription nor subscription_items is provided, you will retrieve the next upcoming invoice from among the customer’s subscriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.SubscriptionItems
member.summary: List of subscription items, each with an attached plan.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.SubscriptionProrate
member.summary: If previewing an update to a subscription, this decides whether the preview will show the result of applying prorations or not. If set, one of subscription_items or subscription, and one of subscription_items or subscription_trial_end are required.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.SubscriptionProrationBehavior
member.summary: Determines how to handle prorations when the billing cycle changes. The value defaults to create_prorations, indicating that proration invoice items should be created. Prorations can be disabled by setting the value to none.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.SubscriptionProrationDate
member.summary: If previewing an update to a subscription, and doing proration, subscription_proration_date forces the proration to be calculated as though the update was done at the specified time. The time given must be within the current subscription period, and cannot be before the subscription was on its current plan. If set, subscription, and one of subscription_items, or subscription_trial_end are required. Also, subscription_proration cannot be set to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.SubscriptionStartDate
member.summary: Date a subscription is intended to start (can be future or past).

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.SubscriptionTaxPercent
member.summary: If provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with that tax percent. If set, one of subscription_items or subscription is required.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.SubscriptionTrialEnd
member.summary: If provided, the invoice returned will preview updating or creating a subscription with that trial end. If set, one of subscription_items or subscription is required.

member.name: P:Stripe.UpcomingInvoiceOptions.SubscriptionTrialFromPlan
member.summary: Indicates if a plan’s trial_period_days should be applied to the subscription. Setting subscription_trial_end per subscription is preferred, and this defaults to false. Setting this flag to true together with subscription_trial_end is not allowed.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.AlwaysPrompt
member.summary: Boolean to indicate that the user should always be asked to connect, even if they're already connected. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.ClientId
member.summary: The unique identifier provided to your application, found in your application settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.ResponseType
member.summary: The only option at the moment is code.

summary.para: The URL for the authorize response redirect. If provided, this must exactly match one of the comma-separated redirect_uri values in your application settings.
To protect yourself from certain forms of man-in-the-middle attacks, the live mode redirect_uri must use a secure HTTPS connection.
Defaults to the redirect_uri in your application settings if not provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.Scope
member.summary: read_write or read_only, depending on the level of access you need. Defaults to read_only.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.State
member.summary: An arbitrary string value we will pass back to you, useful for CSRF protection.

summary.para: login or register, depending on what type of screen you want your users to see. Only override this to be login if you expect all your users to have Stripe accounts already (e.g., most read-only applications, like analytics dashboards or accounting software).
Defaults to login for scope read_only and register for scope read_write.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.StripeUser
member.summary: Prefilled details in the account form for new users.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.SuggestedCapabilities
member.summary: If your platform is designated for one Capability (either card_payments or transfers), you won’t need to specify additional Capabilities. However, if your platform supports both, you can add a Capability to an individual Express account by including the parameter in your OAuth link.

summary.para: The Kana variation of the address block.
This parameter is only relevant for Japan. You must prefill with JP and with a valid Japanese postal code to use this parameter.
The Kanji variation of the address block.
This parameter is only relevant for Japan. You must prefill with JP and with a valid Japanese postal code to use this parameter.
The Kana variation of the address building.
This parameter is only relevant for Japan. You must prefill with JP and with a valid Japanese postal code to use this parameter.
The Kanji variation of the address building.
This parameter is only relevant for Japan. You must prefill with JP and with a valid Japanese postal code to use this parameter.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.BusinessName
member.summary: The legal name of the business, also used for the statement descriptor.

summary.para: The type of the business.
Must be one of sole_prop, corporation, non_profit, partnership, or llc.
Address city of the business.
We highly recommend that you also prefill with the corresponding country.
Two-letter country code (e.g., US or CA).
Must be a country that Stripe currently supports.
Three-letter ISO code representing currency, in lowercase (e.g., usd or cad).
Must be a valid country and currency combination that Stripe supports.
Must prefill with the corresponding country.
Day (1-31) for the birth date of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
If filling this property, you must also fill and .
Month (1-12) for the birth date of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
If filling this property, you must also fill and .
Year (YYYY, greather than 1900) for the birth date of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
If filling this property, you must also fill and .

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.Email
member.summary: The user's email address. Must be a valid email format.
member.remarks: Recommended.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.FirstName
member.summary: First name of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.

summary.para: The Kana variation of the first name of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
Must prefill with JP, as this parameter is only relevant for Japan.
The Kanji variation of the first name of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
Must prefill with JP, as this parameter is only relevant for Japan.
The gender of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application. (International regulations require either male or female.)
Must prefill with JP, as this parameter is only relevant for Japan.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.LastName
member.summary: Last name of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.

summary.para: The Kana variation of the last name of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
Must prefill with JP, as this parameter is only relevant for Japan.
The Kanji variation of the last name of the person who will be filling out a Stripe application.
Must prefill with JP, as this parameter is only relevant for Japan.
The business phone number. Must be 10 digits only.
Must also prefill with the corresponding country.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.PhysicalProduct
member.summary: true if the user sells a physical product, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.ProductDescription
member.summary: A description of what the business is accepting payments for.

summary.para: Address state of the business. Must be the two-letter state or province code (e.g., NY for a U.S. business or AB for a Canadian one).
Must also prefill with the corresponding country.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.StreetAddress
member.summary: Street address of the business.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.Url

summary.para: The URL for the user's business. This may be the user's website, a profile page within your application, or another publicly available profile for the business, such as a LinkedIn or Facebook profile.
Must be URL-encoded and include a scheme (http or https).

If you will be prefilling this field, we highly recommend that the linked page contain a description of the user's products or services and their contact information. If we don't have enough information, we'll have to reach out to the user directly before initiating payouts.

member.remarks: Recommended.

summary.para: Address postal code of the business.
We highly recommend that you also prefill with the corresponding country.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthDeauthorizeOptions.ClientId
member.summary: The client_id of the application that you'd like to disconnect the account from. The account must be connected to this application.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthDeauthorizeOptions.StripeUserId
member.summary: The account you'd like to disconnect from.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.AssertCapabilities
member.summary: If you specified a Capability using the parameter, you can verify that Stripe applied the suggested Capability in this POST request by including and identifying that card_payments or transfers match. A request error will be returned if the suggested Capability doesn’t match the assertion: in this case, it’s recommended to end the onboarding flow with a failure.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.ClientSecret
member.summary: The secret API key. When converting an authorization code to an access token, you must use an API key that matches the mode—live or test—of the authorization code (which depends on whether the client_id used was production or development).

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.Code
member.summary: The value of the code, depending on the grant_type.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.GrantType
member.summary: authorization_code when turning an authorization code into an access token, or refresh_token when using a refresh token to get a new access token.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.RefreshToken
member.summary: The value of the refresh_token, depending on the grant_type.

summary.para: When requesting a new access token from a refresh token, any scope that has an equal or lesser scope as the refresh token. Has no effect when requesting an access token from an authorization code.
Defaults to the scope of the refresh token.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Coupon
member.summary: A coupon code that represents a discount to be applied to this order. Must be one-time duration and in tbe same currency as the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: REQUIRED: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer to use for this order. If provided, the customer email and shipping address will be used to create the order. Subsequently, the customer will also be charged to pay the order. If email or shipping are also provided, they will override the values retrieved from the customer object.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Email
member.summary: The email address of the customer placing the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Items
member.summary: List of items constituting the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an order object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping address for the order. Required if any of the SKUs are for products that have shippable set to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderItemOptions.Parent
member.summary: The ID of the SKU being ordered.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: The quantity of this order item. When type is sku, this is the number of instances of the SKU to be ordered.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderListOptions.Customer
member.summary: Only return orders for the given customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderListOptions.Ids
member.summary: Only return orders with the given IDs.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderListOptions.Status
member.summary: Only return orders that have the given status. One of created, paid, fulfilled, or refunded.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderListOptions.StatusTransitions
member.summary: Only return orders that match the given status_transitions. One of canceled, fulfilled, paid or returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderListOptions.UpstreamIds
member.summary: Only return orders with the given upstream order IDs.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer that will be charged in this request.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.Source
member.summary: A payment source to be charged, such as a credit card. If you also pass a customer ID, the source must be the ID of a source belonging to the customer. Otherwise, if you do not pass a customer ID, the source you provide must either be a token, like the ones returned by Stripe.js.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.ApplicationFee
member.summary: A fee in cents that will be applied to the order and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. To use an application fee, the request must be made on behalf of another account, using the Stripe-Account header or OAuth key. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.Email
member.summary: The email address of the customer placing the order. If a customer is specified, that customer's email address will be used.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an order object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderReturnItemOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount (price) for this order item to return.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderReturnItemOptions.Description
member.summary: If returning a tax item, use description to disambiguate which one to return.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderReturnItemOptions.Parent
member.summary: The ID of the SKU, tax, or shipping item being returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderReturnItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: When type is sku, this is the number of instances of the SKU to be returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderReturnItemOptions.Type
member.summary: The type of this order item. Must be sku, tax, or shipping.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderReturnOptions.Items
member.summary: List of items to return.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderStatusTransitionsOptions.Canceled
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object canceled field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderStatusTransitionsOptions.Fulfilled
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object fulfilled field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderStatusTransitionsOptions.Paid
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object paid field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderStatusTransitionsOptions.Returned
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object returned field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.Coupon
member.summary: A coupon code that represents a discount to be applied to this order. Must be one-time duration and in tbe same currency as the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an order object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.SelectedShippingMethod
member.summary: The shipping method to select for fulfilling this order. If specified, must be one of the ids of a shipping method in the shipping_methods array. If specified, will overwrite the existing selected shipping method, updating items as necessary.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Tracking information once the order has been fulfilled.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.Status
member.summary: Current order status. One of created, paid, canceled, fulfilled, or returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateShippingOptions.Carrier
member.summary: The name of the carrier like USPS, UPS, or FedEx. ShippingTrackingNumber must also be set with this property.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateShippingOptions.TrackingNumber
member.summary: The tracking number provided by the carrier. ShippingCarrier must also be set with this property.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCancelOptions.CancellationReason
member.summary: Reason for canceling this PaymentIntent. Possible values are duplicate, fraudulent, requested_by_customer, or abandoned.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.AmountToCapture
member.summary: The amount to capture from the PaymentIntent, which must be less than or equal to the original amount. Any additional amount will be automatically refunded. Defaults to the full amount capturable if not provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner’s Stripe account. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a PaymentIntent. This will appear on your customer’s statement when this PaymentIntent succeeds in creating a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.TransferData
member.summary: The parameters used to automatically create a Transfer when the payment succeeds. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.ClientSecret
member.summary: The client secret of the PaymentIntent. Required if a publishable key is used to confirm the payment intent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.ErrorOnRequiresAction
member.summary: If true when confirming a payment, Stripe will automatically fail the payment if it requires an extra action from the user. Default is false.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.Mandate
member.summary: ID of the mandate to be used for this payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.MandateData
member.summary: This hash contains details about the Mandate to create.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.OffSession
member.summary: Set to true to indicate that the customer is not in your checkout flow during this payment attempt, and therefore is unable to authenticate. This parameter is intended for scenarios where you collect card details and charge them later.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the payment method (a PaymentMethod, Card, BankAccount, or saved Source object) to attach to this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethodData
member.summary: Payment-method-specific data used to create a payment method for this payment intent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types (e.g. card) that this PaymentIntent is allowed to use.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.ReturnUrl
member.summary: The URL to redirect your customer back to after they authenticate or cancel their payment on the payment method’s app or site. If you’d prefer to redirect to a mobile application, you can alternatively supply an application URI scheme. This parameter is only used for cards and other redirect-based payment methods.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.SavePaymentMethod
member.summary: If the PaymentIntent has a payment_method and a customer or if you’re attaching a payment method to the PaymentIntent in this request, you can pass this as true to save the payment method to the customer. Defaults to false. If the payment method is already saved to a customer, this does nothing. If this type of payment method cannot be saved to a customer, the request will error.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary: Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent’s payment method. If present, the payment method used with this PaymentIntent can be attached to a Customer, even after the transaction completes. Use on_session if you intend to only reuse the payment method when your customer is present in your checkout flow. Use off_session if your customer may or may not be in your checkout flow. Stripe uses this to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules. For example, if your customer is impacted by SCA, using off_session will ensure that they are authenticated while processing this PaymentIntent. You will then be able to make later off-session payments for this customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.Source
member.summary: ID of the Source to use with this PaymentIntent. Prefer using .

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.UseStripeSdk
member.summary: Set to true only when using manual confirmation and the iOS or Android SDKs to handle additional authentication steps.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a zero-decimal currency).

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner’s Stripe account. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.CaptureMethod
member.summary: One of automatic (default) or manual. When the capture method is automatic, Stripe automatically captures funds when the customer authorizes the payment. Change the capture method to manual if you wish to separate authorization and capture for payment methods that support this.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Confirm
member.summary: Set to true to attempt to confirm this PaymentIntent immediately. This parameter defaults to false. If the payment method attached is a card, a return_url may be provided in case additional authentication is required.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.ConfirmationMethod
member.summary: One of automatic (default) or manual. When the confirmation method is automatic, a PaymentIntent can be confirmed using a publishable key. After next actions are handled, no additional confirmation is required to complete the payment. When the confirmation method is manual, all payment attempts must be made using a secret key. The PaymentIntent returns to the requires_confirmation state after handling next_actions, and requires your server to initiate each payment attempt with an explicit confirmation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists. If present, payment methods used with this PaymentIntent can only be attached to this Customer, and payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.ErrorOnRequiresAction
member.summary: If true, Stripe will automatically fail the payment if it requires an extra action from the user. Default is false.

member.summary: ID of the mandate to be used for this payment.

member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.summary: Set to true only when using manual confirmation and the iOS or Android SDKs to handle additional authentication steps.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentTransferDataOptions.Destination

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: REQUIRED. A positive integer in cents representing how much to payout.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: REQUIRED. Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users. This can be unset by updating the value to null and then saving.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.Destination
member.summary: The ID of a bank account or a card to send the payout to. If no destination is supplied, the default external account for the specified currency will be used.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to a payout object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the payout in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.Method
member.summary: The method used to send this payout, which can be standard or instant. instant is only supported for payouts to debit cards. (See Instant payouts for marketplaces for more information.)

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.SourceType
member.summary: The source balance to draw this payout from. Balances for different payment sources are kept separately. You can find the amounts with the balances API. One of bank_account or card.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: A string to be displayed on the recipient’s bank or card statement. This may be at most 22 characters. Attempting to use a statement_descriptor longer than 22 characters will return an error. Note: Most banks will truncate this information and/or display it inconsistently. Some may not display it at all.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutListOptions.ArrivalDate
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object arrival_date field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutListOptions.Destination
member.summary: The ID of an external account - only return payouts sent to this external account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutListOptions.Status
member.summary: Only return payouts that have the given status: pending, paid, failed, or canceled.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to a payout object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the payout in a structured format.

At the time the account is created, this person should be set to the person responsible for opening the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the plan is currently available for new subscriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.AggregateUsage
member.summary: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for plans where is metered. Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for picking the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for picking the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which picks the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount in cents to be charged on the interval specified.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.AmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as , but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.BillingScheme
member.summary: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in amount) will be charged per unit in quantity (for plans with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for plans with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the and attributes.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Id
member.summary: An identifier randomly generated by Stripe. Used to identify this plan when subscribing a customer. You can optionally override this ID, but the ID must be unique across all plans in your Stripe account. You can, however, use the same plan ID in both live and test modes.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Interval
member.summary: One of day, week, month or year. The frequency with which a subscription should be billed.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals (specified in the interval property) between subscription billings.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a subscription object.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the plan, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Product
member.summary: The product whose pricing the created plan will represent. This can either be the ID of an existing product, or a instance containing fields used to create a service product.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Tiers
member.summary: Each element represents a pricing tier. This parameter requires to be set to tiered.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.TiersMode
member.summary: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price, in graduated tiering pricing can successively change as the quantity grows.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.TransformUsage
member.summary: Apply a transformation to the reported usage or set quantity before computing the billed price. Cannot be combined with .

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this plan using trial_from_plan=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.UsageType
member.summary: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined, can be either metered or licensed. licensed will automatically bill the quantity set for a plan when adding it to a subscription, metered will aggregate the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to licensed.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanListOptions.Product
member.summary: Only return plans for the given product.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.FlatAmount
member.summary: The flat billing amount for an entire tier, regardless of the number of units in the tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.FlatAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as flat_amount, but accepts a decimal value representing an integer in the minor units of the currency. Only one of flat_amount and flat_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The per unit billing amount for each individual unit for which this tier applies.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.UpTo
member.summary: Specifies the upper bound of this tier. The lower bound of a tier is the upper bound of the previous tier adding one. Use to define a fallback tier.

member.name: F:Stripe.PlanTierUpTo.Inf
member.summary: Use this value to define a fallback tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the plan is currently available for new subscriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a subscription object.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the plan, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.Product
member.summary: The product the plan belongs to. Note that after updating, statement descriptors and line items of the plan in active subscriptions will be affected.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this plan using trial_from_plan=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the price can be used for new purchases.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.BillingScheme
member.summary: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in or will be charged per unit in quantity (for prices with set to licensed), or per unit of total usage (for prices with set to metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the and attributes.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.LookupKey
member.summary: A lookup key used to retrieve prices dynamically from a static string.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the price, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Product
member.summary: The ID of the product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.ProductData
member.summary: These fields can be used to create a new product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Recurring
member.summary: The recurring components of a price such as its interval.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Tiers
member.summary: Each element represents a pricing tier. This parameter requires to be set to tiered.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.TiersMode
member.summary: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price, in graduated tiering pricing can successively change as the quantity grows.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.TransferLookupKey
member.summary: If set to true, will atomically remove the lookup key from the existing price, and assign it to this price.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.TransformQuantity
member.summary: Apply a transformation to the reported usage or set quantity before computing the billed price. Cannot be combined with .

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The amount in cents to be charged on the interval specified.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as , but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceListOptions.Active
member.summary: Only return prices that are active or inactive.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceListOptions.Currency
member.summary: Only return prices for the given currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceListOptions.LookupKeys
member.summary: Only return the price with these lookup keys, if any exist.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceListOptions.Product
member.summary: Only return prices for the given product.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceListOptions.Recurring
member.summary: Only return prices with these recurring fields.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceListOptions.Type
member.summary: Only return prices of type recurring or one_time.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceProductDataOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the product is currently available for purchase. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceProductDataOptions.Id
member.summary: The identifier for the product. Must be unique. If not provided, an identifier will be randomly generated.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceProductDataOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceProductDataOptions.Name
member.summary: The product’s name, meant to be displayable to the customer. Whenever this product is sold via a subscription, name will show up on associated invoice line item descriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceProductDataOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer’s credit card or bank statement.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceProductDataOptions.UnitLabel
member.summary: A label that represents units of this product in Stripe and on customers’ receipts and invoices. When set, this will be included in associated invoice line item descriptions.

member.summary: Filter by billing frequency. Either day, week, month or year.

member.summary: Filter by the usage type for this price. Can be either metered or licensed.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurringOptions.AggregateUsage
member.summary: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for prices where is metered. Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for picking the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for picking the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which picks the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum.
