member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in cents representing how much of this charge to refund. Can refund only up to the remaining, unrefunded amount of the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.Charge
member.summary: The ID of the Charge to refund.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to a Refund object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the refund in a structured format. You can unset individual keys if you POST an empty value for that key. You can clear all keys if you POST an empty value for metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.PaymentIntent
member.summary: The ID of the PaymentIntent to refund.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.Reason
member.summary: String indicating the reason for the refund. If set, possible values are duplicate, fraudulent, and requested_by_customer. If you believe the charge to be fraudulent, specifying fraudulent as the reason will add the associated card and email to your blocklists, and will also help us improve our fraud detection algorithms.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.RefundApplicationFee
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether the application fee should be refunded when refunding this charge. If a full charge refund is given, the full application fee will be refunded. Otherwise, the application fee will be refunded in an amount proportional to the amount of the charge refunded. An application fee can be refunded only by the application that created the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundCreateOptions.ReverseTransfer
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether the transfer should be reversed when refunding this charge. The transfer will be reversed proportionally to the amount being refunded (either the entire or partial amount). A transfer can be reversed only by the application that created the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundListOptions.Charge
member.summary: Only return refunds for the Charge specified by this ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.RefundListOptions.PaymentIntent
member.summary: Only return refunds for the PaymentIntent specified by this ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCancelOptions.CancellationReason
member.summary: Reason for canceling this SetupIntent. Possible values are abandoned, requested_by_customer, or duplicate.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentConfirmOptions.ClientSecret
member.summary: The client secret of the SetupIntent. Required if a publishable key is used to confirm the setup intent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentConfirmOptions.MandateData
member.summary: This hash contains details about the Mandate to create.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the payment method (a PaymentMethod, Card, BankAccount, or saved Source object) to attach to this SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration for this SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentConfirmOptions.ReturnUrl
member.summary: The URL to redirect your customer back to after they authenticate on the payment method’s app or site. If you’d prefer to redirect to a mobile application, you can alternatively supply an application URI scheme. This parameter is only used for cards and other redirect-based payment methods.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.Confirm
member.summary: Set to true to attempt to confirm this SetupIntent immediately. This parameter defaults to false. If the payment method attached is a card, a ReturnUrl may be provided in case additional authentication is required.

summary.para: ID of the Customer this SetupIntent belongs to, if one exists.
If present, payment methods used with this SetupIntent can only be attached to this Customer, and payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users. This can be unset by updating the value to null and then saving.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.MandateData
member.summary: This hash contains details about the Mandate to create.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an order object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The Stripe account ID for which this SetupIntent is created.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.PaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the payment method (a PaymentMethod, Card, BankAccount, or saved Source object) to attach to this SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration for this SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types that this SetupIntent is allowed to set up. If this is not provided, defaults to card.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.ReturnUrl
member.summary: The URL to redirect your customer back to after they authenticate on the payment method’s app or site. If you’d prefer to redirect to a mobile application, you can alternatively supply an application URI scheme. This parameter is only used for cards and other redirect-based payment methods.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.SingleUse
member.summary: If this hash is populated, this SetupIntent will generate a single use Mandate on success.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentCreateOptions.Usage
member.summary: Indicates how the payment method is intended to be used in the future. Use on_session if you intend to only reuse the payment method when the customer is in your checkout flow. Use off_session if your customer may or may not be in your checkout flow. If not provided, this value defaults to off_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentGetOptions.ClientSecret
member.summary: The client secret of the SetupIntent. Required if a publishable key is used to retrieve the setup intent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentMandateDataCustomerAcceptanceOnlineOptions.IpAddress
member.summary: The IP address from which the Mandate was accepted by the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentMandateDataCustomerAcceptanceOnlineOptions.UserAgent
member.summary: The user agent of the browser from which the Mandate was accepted by the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentMandateDataCustomerAcceptanceOptions.AcceptedAt
member.summary: at which the customer accepted the Mandate.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentMandateDataCustomerAcceptanceOptions.Offline
member.summary: If this is a Mandate accepted offline, this hash contains details about the offline acceptance.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentMandateDataCustomerAcceptanceOptions.Online
member.summary: If this is a Mandate accepted online, this hash contains details about the online acceptance.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentMandateDataCustomerAcceptanceOptions.Type
member.summary: The type of customer acceptance information included with the Mandate. One of online or offline.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentMandateDataOptions.CustomerAcceptance
member.summary: This hash contains details about the customer acceptance of the Mandate.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.Moto
member.summary: When specified, this parameter signals that a card has been collected as MOTO (Mail Order Telephone Order) and is thus out of scope for SCA.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: Control when to request 3D Secure on this SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.Card
member.summary: Configuration for any card payments attempted on this SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentSingleUseOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount associated with the Mandate created by this SetupIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentSingleUseOptions.Currency
member.summary: 3-letter ISO code for currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuCreateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether or not the SKU is currently available for purchase. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuCreateOptions.Attributes
member.summary: A dictionary of attributes and values for the attributes defined by the product. If, for example, a product’s attributes are ["size", "gender"], a valid SKU has the following dictionary of attributes: {"size": "Medium", "gender": "Unisex"}.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuCreateOptions.Id
member.summary: The identifier for the SKU. Must be unique. If not provided, an identifier will be randomly generated.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuCreateOptions.Image
member.summary: The URL of an image for this SKU, meant to be displayable to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuCreateOptions.Inventory
member.summary: Description of the SKU’s inventory.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuCreateOptions.PackageDimensions
member.summary: The dimensions of this SKU for shipping purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuCreateOptions.Price
member.summary: The cost of the item as a positive integer in the smallest currency unit (that is, 100 cents to charge $1.00, or 100 to charge ¥100, Japanese Yen being a 0-decimal currency).

member.name: P:Stripe.SkuCreateOptions.Product
member.summary: The ID of the product this SKU is associated with. The product must be currently active.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceAttachOptions.Source
member.summary: REQUIRED: The identifier of the source to be attached.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount associated with the source. This is the amount for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for single-use sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: The currency associated with the source. This is the currency for which the source will be chargeable once ready.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The customer associated with the Source that you are trying to share with a Connected account. This only works with Stripe Connect as documented here.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.Flow
member.summary: The authentication flow of the source to create. Flow is one of . It is generally inferred unless a type supports multiple flows.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.Mandate
member.summary: Information about a mandate possiblity attached to a source object (generally for bank debits) as well as its acceptance status.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a source object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the source in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.OriginalSource
member.summary: The id of the Source that you are trying to share with a Connected account. This only works with Stripe Connect as documented here.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.Owner
member.summary: Information about the owner of the payment instrument that may be used or required by particular source types.

summary.para: Parameters required for the redirect flow. Required if the source is authenticated by a redirect (flow is redirect).

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.Receiver
member.summary: Optional parameters for the receiver flow. Can be set only if the source is a receiver.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.SourceOrder
member.summary: Information about the items and shipping associated with the source.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer’s statement.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.Token
member.summary: An optional token used to create the source. When passed, token properties will override source parameters.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.Type
member.summary: REQUIRED: The type of the source to create. One of type .

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCreateOptions.Usage
member.summary: One of . Whether this source should be reusable or not. Some source types may or may not be reusable by construction, while other may leave the option at creation. If an incompatible value is passed, an error will be returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceGetOptions.ClientSecret
member.summary: The client secret of the source. Required if a publishable key is used to retrieve the source.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrderItemOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount (price) for this order item.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrderItemOptions.Currency
member.summary: This currency of this order item. Required when amount is present.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrderItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: The quantity of this order item. When type is sku, this is the number of instances of the SKU to be ordered.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrderItemOptions.Type
member.summary: The type of this order item. Must be sku, tax, or shipping.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrderOptions.Items
member.summary: List of items constituting the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrderOptions.Shipping
member.summary: The shipping address for the order. Present if the order is for goods to be shipped.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceUpdateOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount associated with the source.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceUpdateOptions.Mandate
member.summary: Information about a mandate possiblity attached to a source object (generally for bank debits) as well as its acceptance status.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a source object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the source in a structured format. You can unset individual keys if you POST an empty value for that key. You can clear all keys if you POST an empty value for metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceUpdateOptions.Owner

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceUpdateOptions.SourceOrder

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemCreateOptions.PaymentBehavior
member.summary: Use error_if_incomplete if you want Stripe to return an HTTP 402 status code if the invoice caused by the item creation cannot be paid. Otherwise use allow_incomplete.

member.summary: The ID of the plan to add to the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemCreateOptions.Prorate

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemCreateOptions.ProrationBehavior
member.summary: Determines how to handle prorations when the billing cycle changes. The value defaults to create_prorations, indicating that proration invoice items should be created. Prorations can be disabled by setting the value to none.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemCreateOptions.ProrationDate
member.summary: If set, the proration will be calculated as though the subscription was updated at the given time. This can be used to apply the same proration that was previewed with the upcoming invoice endpoint.

member.summary: If set, the proration will be calculated as though the subscription was updated at the given time. This can be used to apply the same proration that was previewed with the upcoming invoice endpoint.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCancelOptions.InvoiceNow
member.summary: Will generate a final invoice that invoices for any un-invoiced metered usage and new/pending proration invoice items.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCancelOptions.Prorate
member.summary: If the subscription schedule is active, indicates if the cancellation should be prorated. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The identifier of the customer to create the subscription schedule for.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.DefaultSettings
member.summary: Object representing the subscription schedule’s default settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.EndBehavior
member.summary: Behavior of the subscription schedule and underlying subscription when it ends. Possible values are cancel, none, release and renew.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.FromSubscription
member.summary: Migrate an existing subscription to be managed by a subscription schedule. If this parameter is set, a subscription schedule will be created using the subscription’s plan(s), set to auto-renew using the subscription’s interval. Other parameters cannot be set since their values will be inferred from the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.InvoiceSettings
member.summary: Define the default settings applied to invoices created by this subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a subscription schedule object.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.Phases
member.summary: List representing phases of the subscription schedule. Each phase can be customized to have different durations, plans, and coupons. If there are multiple phases, the end_date of one phase will always equal the start_date of the next phase.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleCreateOptions.StartDate
member.summary: The date at which the subscription schedule starts.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay the underlying subscription at the end of each billing cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions. Defaults to charge_automatically on creation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.InvoiceSettings
member.summary: Define the default settings applied to invoices created by this subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettingsOptions.TransferData
member.summary: The account (if any) the subscription's payments will be attributed to for tax reporting, and where funds from each payment will be transferred to for each of the subscription's invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleInvoiceSettingsOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: The number of days from which the invoice is created until it is due. Only valid for invoices where billing=send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleListOptions.CanceledAt
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object canceled_at field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleListOptions.CompletedAt
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object completed_at field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleListOptions.Customer
member.summary: Only return subscription schedules for the given customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleListOptions.ReleasedAt
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object released_at field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleListOptions.Scheduled
member.summary: Only return subscription schedules that have not started yet.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.Plan
member.summary: Plan ID for this item.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Quantity for this item.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseItemOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: Ids of the tax rates to apply to this item for a phase on the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.AddInvoiceItems
member.summary: A list of prices and quantities that will generate invoice items appended to the next invoice. You may pass up to 10 items.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner’s Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay the underlying subscription at the end of each billing cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions. Defaults to charge_automatically on creation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Coupon
member.summary: The code of the coupon to apply to this subscription. A coupon applied to a subscription will only affect invoices created for that particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: Ids of the tax rates to apply to this phase on the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.EndDate
member.summary: The date at which this phase of the subscription schedule ends. If set, iterations must not be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.InvoiceSettings
member.summary: Define the default settings applied to invoices created by this subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Iterations
member.summary: Integer representing the multiplier applied to the plan interval. For example, iterations=2 applied to a plan with interval=month and interval_count=3 results in a phase of duration 2 * 3 months = 6 months. If set, end_date must not be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Plans
member.summary: List of configuration items, each with an attached plan, to apply during this phase of the subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.ProrationBehavior
member.summary: If the update changes the current phase, indicates if the changes should be prorated. Valid values are create_prorations or none, and the default value is create_prorations.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.StartDate
member.summary: The date at which this phase of the subscription schedule starts.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.TaxPercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal (with at most four decimal places) between 0 and 100. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be calculated and added as tax to the final amount each billing period. For example, a plan which charges $10/month with a tax_percent of 20.0 will charge $12 per invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.TransferData
member.summary: The account (if any) the subscription's payments will be attributed to for tax reporting, and where funds from each payment will be transferred to for each of the subscription's invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.Trial
member.summary: If set to true the entire phase is counted as a trial and the customer will not be charged for any fees.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSchedulePhaseOptions.TrialEnd
member.summary: Sets the phase to trialing from the start date to this date. Must be before the phase end date, can not be combined with trial.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleReleaseOptions.PreserveCancelDate
member.summary: Keep any cancellation on the subscription that the schedule has set.

member.name: F:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleStartDate.Now
member.summary: Special value used to start a subscription schedule immediately.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.DefaultSettings
member.summary: Object representing the subscription schedule’s default settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.EndBehavior
member.summary: Behavior of the subscription schedule and underlying subscription when it ends. Possible values are cancel, none, release and renew.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.InvoiceSettings
member.summary: Define the default settings applied to invoices created by this subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a subscription schedule object.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.Phases
member.summary: List representing phases of the subscription schedule. Each phase can be customized to have different durations, plans, and coupons. If there are multiple phases, the end_date of one phase will always equal the start_date of the next phase.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.Prorate
member.summary: If the update changes the current phase, indicates if the changes should be prorated. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleUpdateOptions.ProrationBehavior
member.summary: If the update changes the current phase, indicates if the changes should be prorated. Valid values are create_prorations or none, and the default value is create_prorations.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionAddInvoiceItemOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionAddInvoiceItemOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionAddInvoiceItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Quantity for this item.

member.name: F:Stripe.SubscriptionBillingCycleAnchor.Now
member.summary: Resets the subscription's billing cycle anchor to the current time.

member.name: F:Stripe.SubscriptionBillingCycleAnchor.Unchanged
member.summary: Leaves the subscription's billing cycle anchor unchanged.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionBillingThresholdsOptions.AmountGte
member.summary: Monetary threshold that triggers the subscription to advance to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionBillingThresholdsOptions.ResetBillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Indicates if the billing_reason should be reset when a threshold is reached. If true, billing_reason will be updated to the date/time the threshold was last reached; otherwise, the value will remain unchanged.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCancelOptions.InvoiceNow
member.summary: Will generate a final invoice that invoices for any un-invoiced metered usage and new/pending proration invoice items.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCancelOptions.Prorate
member.summary: Boolean (default true). Use with a billing_cycle_anchor timestamp to determine whether the customer will be invoiced a prorated amount until the anchor date. If false, the anchor period will be free (similar to a trial).

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.AddInvoiceItems
member.summary: A list of prices and quantities that will generate invoice items appended to the first invoice for this subscription. You may pass up to 10 items.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner’s Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key in order to set an application fee percentage. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.BackdateStartDate
member.summary: For new subscriptions, a past timestamp to backdate the subscription’s start date to. If set, the first invoice will contain a proration for the timespan between the start date and the current time. Can be combined with trials and the billing cycle anchor.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.BillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: A future date to anchor the subscription's billing cycle. This is used to determine the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.CancelAt
member.summary: A timestamp at which the subscription should cancel. If set to a date before the current period ends this will cause a proration if prorate=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.CancelAtPeriodEnd
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether this subscription should cancel at the end of the current period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this invoice using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email invoices for this subscription to the customer with payment instructions. Defaults to charge_automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.Coupon
member.summary: The code of the coupon to apply to this subscription. A coupon applied to a subscription will only affect invoices created for that particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: REQUIRED: The identifier of the customer to subscribe.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: Number of days a customer has to pay invoices generated by this subscription. Only valid for subscriptions where billing=send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.DefaultSource
member.summary: ID of the default payment source for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription and be in a chargeable state. If not set, defaults to the customer’s default source.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: IDs of the tax rates to apply to this subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.Items
member.summary: List of subscription items, each with an attached plan.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a subscription object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the subscription in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.OffSession
member.summary: Indicates if a customer is on session while an invoice payment is attempted.

summary.para: Use allow_incomplete to create subscriptions with status=incomplete if its first invoice cannot be paid. Creating subscriptions with this status allows you to manage scenarios where additional user actions are needed to pay a subscription's invoice. For example, SCA regulation may require 3DS authentication to complete payment. See the SCA Migration Guide for Billing to learn more. This is the default behavior.

Use error_if_incomplete if you want Stripe to return an HTTP 402 status code if a subscription's first invoice cannot be paid. For example, if a payment method requires 3DS authentication due to SCA regulation and further user action is needed, this parameter does not create a subscription and returns an error instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.PendingInvoiceItemInterval
member.summary: Specifies an interval for how often to bill for any pending invoice items. It is analogous to creating an invoice for the given subscription at the specified interval.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.Prorate
member.summary: Boolean (default true). Use with a billing_cycle_anchor timestamp to determine whether the customer will be invoiced a prorated amount until the anchor date. If false, the anchor period will be free (similar to a trial).

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.ProrationBehavior
member.summary: Determines how to handle prorations when the billing cycle changes. The value defaults to create_prorations, indicating that proration invoice items should be created. Prorations can be disabled by setting the value to none.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.TaxPercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal (with at most four decimal places) between 0 and 100. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be calculated and added as tax to the final amount each billing period. For example, a plan which charges $10/month with a tax_percent of 20.0 will charge $12 per invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.TrialEnd
member.summary: representing the end of the trial period the customer will get before being charged for the first time. This will always overwrite any trials that might apply via a subscribed plan. If set, will override the default trial period of the plan the customer is being subscribed to. The special value can be provided to end the customer’s trial immediately.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.TrialFromPlan
member.summary: Boolean. Decide whether to use the default trial on the plan when creating a subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionCreateOptions.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Integer representing the number of trial period days before the customer is charged for the first time.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.ClearUsage
member.summary: Delete all usage for a given subscription item. Only allowed when deleted is set to true and the current plan’s usage_type is metered. This parameter is only available on update.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.Deleted
member.summary: Delete the specified item if set to true. This parameter is only available on update.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.Id
member.summary: SubscriptionItem to update. This parameter is only available on update.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a charge object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. It's often a good idea to store an email address in metadata for tracking later.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.Plan
member.summary: Plan ID for this item.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Quantity for this item.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItemOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: Ids of the tax rates to apply to this subscription item.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionListOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the collection method for subscriptions. Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionListOptions.CurrentPeriodEnd
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object current_period_end field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionListOptions.CurrentPeriodStart
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object current_period_start field. The value can be a or a .

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionListOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of the customer whose subscriptions will be retrieved.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionListOptions.Plan
member.summary: The ID of the plan whose subscriptions will be retrieved.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionListOptions.Price
member.summary: Filter for subscriptions that contain this recurring price ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionListOptions.Status
member.summary: The status of the subscriptions to retrieve. One of or all. Passing in a value of canceled will return all canceled subscriptions, including those belonging to deleted customers. Passing in a value of all will return subscriptions of all statuses.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPauseCollectionOptions.Behavior
member.summary: The payment collection behavior for this subscription while paused. One of keep_as_draft, mark_uncollectible, or void.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPauseCollectionOptions.ResumesAt
member.summary: The time after which the subscription will resume collecting payments.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingInvoiceItemIntervalOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies invoicing frequency. Either day, week, month or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingInvoiceItemIntervalOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionTransferDataOptions.AmountPercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the destination account. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: The account where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.

member.name: F:Stripe.SubscriptionTrialEnd.Now
member.summary: Special value used to end a customer's trial immediately.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.AddInvoiceItems
member.summary: A list of prices and quantities that will generate invoice items appended to the first invoice for this subscription. You may pass up to 10 items.

member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner’s Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key in order to set an application fee percentage. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.BillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: One of . Setting the value to resets the subscription’s billing cycle anchor to the current time. For more information, see the billing cycle documentation.

member.summary: Boolean indicating whether this subscription should cancel at the end of the current period.

member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this invoice using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email invoices for this subscription to the customer with payment instructions. Defaults to charge_automatically.

member.summary: The code of the coupon to apply to this subscription. A coupon applied to a subscription will only affect invoices created for that particular subscription.

member.summary: Number of days a customer has to pay invoices generated by this subscription. Only valid for subscriptions where billing=send_invoice.

member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the subscription.

member.summary: ID of the default payment source for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription and be in a chargeable state. If not set, defaults to the customer’s default source.

member.summary: Ids of the tax rates to apply to this subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.Items
member.summary: List of subscription items, each with an attached plan.

summary.para: Use allow_incomplete to create subscriptions with status=incomplete if its first invoice cannot be paid. Creating subscriptions with this status allows you to manage scenarios where additional user actions are needed to pay a subscription's invoice. For example, SCA regulation may require 3DS authentication to complete payment. See the SCA Migration Guide for Billing to learn more. This is the default behavior.

Use error_if_incomplete if you want Stripe to return an HTTP 402 status code if a subscription's first invoice cannot be paid. For example, if a payment method requires 3DS authentication due to SCA regulation and further user action is needed, this parameter does not create a subscription and returns an error instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.PendingInvoiceItemInterval
member.summary: Specifies an interval for how often to bill for any pending invoice items. It is analogous to creating an invoice for the given subscription at the specified interval.

member.summary: Boolean (default true). Use with a billing_cycle_anchor timestamp to determine whether the customer will be invoiced a prorated amount until the anchor date. If false, the anchor period will be free (similar to a trial).

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.ProrationBehavior
member.summary: Determines how to handle prorations when the billing cycle changes. The value defaults to create_prorations, indicating that proration invoice items should be created. Prorations can be disabled by setting the value to none.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.ProrationDate
member.summary: If set, the proration will be calculated as though the subscription was updated at the given time. This can be used to apply exactly the same proration that was previewed with upcoming invoice endpoint. It can also be used to implement custom proration logic, such as prorating by day instead of by second, by providing the time that you wish to use for proration calculations.

member.summary: A non-negative decimal (with at most four decimal places) between 0 and 100. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be calculated and added as tax to the final amount each billing period. For example, a plan which charges $10/month with a tax_percent of 20.0 will charge $12 per invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.TrialEnd
member.summary: representing the end of the trial period the customer will get before being charged for the first time. This will always overwrite any trials that might apply via a subscribed plan. If set, will override the default trial period of the plan the customer is being subscribed to. The special value can be provided to end the customer’s trial immediately.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionUpdateOptions.TrialFromPlan
member.summary: Boolean. Decide whether to use the default trial on the plan when creating a subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.TaxRateCreateOptions.Percentage

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.Address

member.summary: The company’s legal name.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.NameKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the company’s legal name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.NameKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the company’s legal name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.OwnersProvided
member.summary: Whether the company’s owners have been provided. Set this to true after creating all the company’s owners for this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.Phone
member.summary: The company’s phone number (used for verification).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.TaxId
member.summary: The business ID number of the company, as appropriate for the company’s country. (Examples are an Employer ID Number in the U.S., a Business Number in Canada, or a Company Number in the UK.).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.TaxIdRegistrar
member.summary: The jurisdiction in which the tax id is registered (Germany-based companies only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.VatId
member.summary: The VAT number of the company.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyOptions.Verification
member.summary: Information on the verification state of the company.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyVerificationDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyVerificationDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountCompanyVerificationOptions.Document
member.summary: A document verifying the business.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountOptions.BusinessType
member.summary: The business type. Can be individual or company.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountOptions.Company
member.summary: Information about the company or business.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountOptions.Individual
member.summary: Information about the person representing the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenAccountOptions.TosShownAndAccepted
member.summary: Whether the user described by the data in the token has been shown the Stripe Connected Account Agreement. When creating an account token to create a new Connect account, this value must be true.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenCreateOptions.Account
member.summary: Information for the account this token will represent.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenCreateOptions.BankAccount
member.summary: The bank account this token will represent. If you also pass in a customer, the bank account must be the ID of a bank account belonging to the customer. Otherwise, if you do not pass in a customer, this is a instance containing a user's bank account details.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenCreateOptions.Card
member.summary: The card this token will represent. If you also pass in a customer, the card must be the ID of a card belonging to the customer. Otherwise, if you do not pass in a customer, this is a instance containing a user's credit card details.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The customer (owned by the application's account) for which to create a token. For use only with Stripe Connect. Also, this can be used only with an OAuth access token or Stripe-Account header. For more details, see Shared Customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenCreateOptions.Person
member.summary: Information for the account this token will represent.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.Address
member.summary: The person’s address.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.AddressKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the person’s address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.AddressKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the person’s address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.Dob
member.summary: The person’s date of birth.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.Email
member.summary: The person’s email address.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.FirstName
member.summary: The person’s first name.

member.summary: The Kana variation of the person’s first name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.FirstNameKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the person’s first name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.Gender
member.summary: The person’s gender (International regulations require either male or female).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.IdNumber
member.summary: The person’s ID number, as appropriate for their country. For example, a social security number in the U.S., social insurance number in Canada, etc. Instead of the number itself, you can also provide a PII token provided by Stripe.js.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.LastName
member.summary: The person’s last name.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.LastNameKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the person’s last name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.LastNameKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the person’s last name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.MaidenName
member.summary: The person’s maiden name.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.Phone
member.summary: The person’s phone number.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.Relationship
member.summary: The relationship that this person has with the account’s legal entity.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.SSNLast4
member.summary: The last 4 digits of the person’s social security number.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonOptions.Verification
member.summary: The person’s verification status.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonRelationshipOptions.Director
member.summary: Whether the person is a director of the account’s legal entity..

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonRelationshipOptions.Executive
member.summary: Whether the person has significant responsibility to control, manage, or direct the organization.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonRelationshipOptions.Owner
member.summary: Whether the person is an owner of the account’s legal entity..

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonRelationshipOptions.PercentOwnership
member.summary: The percent owned by the person of the account’s legal entity.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonRelationshipOptions.Representative
member.summary: Whether the person is authorized as the primary representative of the account. This is the person nominated by the business to provide information about themselves, and general information about the account. There can only be one representative at any given time. At the time the account is created, this person should be set to the person responsible for opening the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonRelationshipOptions.Title
member.summary: The person’s title (e.g., CEO, Support Engineer).

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonVerificationDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonVerificationDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonVerificationOptions.AdditionalDocument
member.summary: A document showing address, either a passport, local ID card, or utility bill from a well-known utility company.

member.name: P:Stripe.TokenPersonVerificationOptions.Document
member.summary: An identifying document, either a passport or local ID card.

member.name: P:Stripe.TopupCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to top up $1.00 or 100 to top up ¥100, a 0-decimal currency) representing how much to top up your Stripe balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.TopupCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: 3-letter ISO code for currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.TopupCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a Top-up object. It is displayed when in the web interface alongside the Top-up.

member.name: P:Stripe.TopupCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a Top-up object. It can be useful for storing additional information in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.TopupCreateOptions.Source
member.summary: The ID of a source to transfer funds from. For most users, this should be left unspecified which will use the bank account that was set up in the dashboard for the specified currency. In test mode, this can be a test bank token (see Testing Top-ups).

member.name: P:Stripe.TopupCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a top-up for the source’s bank statement. Limited to 15 ASCII characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.TopupCreateOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this top-up as part of a group.

member.summary: is a generic class that can hold a value of one of two different types. It uses implicit conversion operators to seamlessly accept or return either type. member.name: T:Stripe.BaseOptions
member.summary: Base class for Stripe options classes, i.e. classes representing parameters for Stripe API requests.

member.name: P:Stripe.BaseOptions.Expand
member.summary: Specifies which fields in the response should be expanded.

member.name: P:Stripe.BaseOptions.ExtraParams
member.summary: Dictionary containing extra request parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.BaseOptions.AddExpand(System.String)
member.summary: Adds an expand value to the request, to request expansion of a specific field in the response. When requesting expansions in a list request, don't forget to prefix the field names with data..
member.param: The name of the field to expand.

member.name: M:Stripe.BaseOptions.AddRangeExpand(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Adds a collection of expand values to the request, to request expansion of specific fields in the response. When requesting expansions in a list request, don't forget to prefix the field names with data..
member.param: The collection of names of the fields to expand.

member.name: M:Stripe.BaseOptions.AddExtraParam(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an extra parameter to the request. This can be useful if you need to use parameters not available in regular options classes, e.g. for beta features.

member.name: P:Stripe.ListOptions.Limit
member.summary: A limit on the number of objects to be returned, between 1 and 100.

member.name: P:Stripe.ListOptions.StartingAfter
member.summary: A cursor for use in pagination. starting_after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include starting_after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

member.name: P:Stripe.ListOptions.EndingBefore
member.summary: A cursor for use in pagination. ending_before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_bar, your subsequent call can include ending_before=obj_bar in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

member.name: P:Stripe.ListOptionsWithCreated.Created
member.summary: A filter on the list based on the object created field. The value can be a or a .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a custom .
member.param: The client used by the service to send requests.

member.name: P:Stripe.Service`1.Client
member.summary: Gets or sets the client used by this service to send requests. If no client was set when the service instance was created, then the default client in is used instead.
member.remarks: Setting the client at runtime may not be thread-safe. If you wish to use a custom client, it is recommended that you pass it to the service's constructor and not change it during the service's lifetime.

member.name: T:Stripe.StringEnum
member.summary: Abstract base class for string enum parameters.
member.remarks: This class is used to define request parameters that can only take certain string values. We use it instead of defining a regular enum with annotations for serialization because enum is really an integer under the hood. This can be problematic in some cases, like when a parameter can be an integer OR a string enum (e.g. ).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The serialized value for the instance.

member.summary: Gets or sets the serialized value.
member.returns: The serialized value.

member.name: M:Stripe.StringEnum.ToString
member.summary: Returns the serialized value.
member.returns: The serialized value.

member.name: P:Stripe.RequestOptions.ApiKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the API key to use for the request.

member.name: P:Stripe.RequestOptions.IdempotencyKey
member.summary: Get or sets the idempotency key to use for the request.

member.name: P:Stripe.RequestOptions.StripeAccount
member.summary: Get or sets the ID of the connected account to use for the request.

member.name: P:Stripe.RequestOptions.BaseUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the base URL for the request.
member.remarks: This is an internal property. It is set by services or individual request methods when they need to send a request to a non-standard destination, e.g. files.stripe.com for file creation requests or connect.stripe.com for OAuth requests.

member.name: P:Stripe.RequestOptions.StripeVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the API version for the request.
member.remarks: This is an internal property. For most requests, the API version is always set to the library's pinned version (). This property is only used for creating ephemeral keys, which require a specific API version.
